div0.head: *z
div0.entryFree:
*zz, zh=ta (q.v.), to/, indecl., seventh (later sixth) letter of Gr. alphabet (cf. IG14.2420): as numeral z/ = e(pta/ and e(/bdomos （s/, i.e. vvau=, the digamma, being retained to represent e(/c, e(/ktos), but z' = 7,000. Zeta, being a double consonant (pronounced either as
zd or as
dz acc. to dialect and date), made a short vowel at the end of the foregoing syllable long by position; exc. before pr. names, which could not otherwise come into the hexam., a)/stu^ *zelei/hs Il.4.103, 121; u(lh/essa^ *za/kunqos h.Ap.429, etc.: afterwds. pronounced as Engl.
z, cf. zmh=nos PCair.Zen.151.4 (iii B.C.), zmu/rnhs ib.9 (iii B.C.), a)mfizbh/thsin Mitteis Chr.31 viii 6 (ii B.C.), cf. Ael.Dion.Fr.187; sts. sz was written, e)nde/szmous IG22.1672.308 (iv B.C.), qusia/szein IG 3.73.

za/ [a^], Aeol. for dia/, rarely as Prep., za\ ta\n sa\n i)de/an Theoc.29.6, cf. IG12(2).484.3 (Mytil.); za\ nukto/s ap.Jo.Gramm.Comp.3.3; za\ xw=ris e)/xhn Sapph.Oxy.1787 Fr.3ii 18; zaba/llw, za/hmi, etc. as Prefix (cf. dia/),
very, in Ep. Adjs., zah/s, za/qeos, za/kotos, etc.; cf. zamene/w, za/ploutos, za/felos.
za=,= gh=, Inscr.Cypr.135.8H.; but zan, dub. sens. in the phrase u)vais zan, ib.10 (fort. = dia\ bi/ou).
zaba/llw, Aeol. for diaba/llw,= e)capatw=, Hsch., EM406.42.
za/batos, on, Aeol. for diabato/s, Sapph.158. = pi/nac i)xquhro/s (Paph.), Hsch. (cf. gabaqo/n, kaba/qa).
zableme/nws: mega/lws pepoiqw/s, Hsch.; cf. blemeai/nw, a)bleme/ws.
za/botos, on, （bo/skw） = polu/forbos, polu/kthnos, Hsch.
zabro/s, o/n, for za/boros (?),= polufa/gos, Hsch., Phot., Suid.
za/gklh, h(,= sq., Nic.Al.180. an ancient name of Sicilian Messene, from the shape of the natural mole which forms the harbour, Th.6.4, etc.

za/gklon, to/,
reaping-hook, sickle, Sicilian for dre/panon, Th.6.4, cf. Call.Aet.Oxy.2080.73. (za/gklion,= skolio/n, acc. to Str.6.2.3.)
za/gra, h(, and Dim. za/grion, to/, a term of abuse, Timostr.4.
*zagrai=os, o(, epith. of Dionysus, Orph.Fr.210.

*zagreu/s, e/ws, o(, son of Zeus and Persephone, slain by the Titans and resuscitated as Dionysus, po/tnia gh=, *zagreu= te qew=n panupe/rtate pa/ntwn Alcmaeonis Fr.3 (EGFp.77), cf. E.Fr.472.11 (anap.), Call.Fr. 171, Nonn.D.10.294; identified with *(/aidhs by A.Fr.228. (Glossed by mega/lws a)greu/wn Et.Gud.227.37.)

za/grh: bo/qros, la/paqon, Hsch. za/gros, a, on,
barefoot, Zonar., interpol. in Suid.

za/dhlos, on, for dia/dhlos, of a sail
with holes in it, Alc.18.7.

zaeleca/man,= dieleca/mhn, I
discoursed with, tini Sapph.87 (with vv.Il.; za\ d' e)l. cj. Ahrens).
zazai=os: ei)=dos i)xqu/os, Opp. ap. Cyr. in An.Par.4.182; za/zeos Cyr. ap.Schmidt Hsch. s.v. zaio/s.
za/hmi,= dia/hmi, part. zae/ntes, Hsch.: 3sg. za/ei Id.: but za/ei: binei=, Id. is connected with bi/a (q.v.).

za_h/s, e/s, (za-, a)/hmi) Ep. Adj.
strong-blowing, stormy, a)/nemos zah/s Il.12.157, Od.5.368, prob. cj. in Hes.Th.253; w)=rsen e)/pi zah=n a)/nemon Od.12.313 (cf. Hdn.Gr.2.154, 923); zaou=s *no/tou AP9.290 (Phil.).

za/qeos [a^], a, on, also os, on E.Tr.256 (lyr.), 1075 (lyr.); poet. Adj. (used by Trag. only in lyrics):—
very divine, sacred, of places favoured by the gods, Il.1.38, al. (not in Od.), h.Ap.223; z. *pu/los, *)isqmo/s, Pi.P.5.70, I.1.32, cf. B.2.7; na=sos Id.5.10; *pe/lopos da/peda Id.10.24; e)/nauloi E.Ba.121 (lyr.), etc.; *)/wlenos A.Fr.284; of things, a)/nemoi Hes.Th.253; xro/nos Pi.Pae.6.5; klh=|des, sela=nai, E.Tr.ll.cc.; potamoi/ Ar.Nu.283 (lyr.); molpai/ Id.Ra.385; timai/ Castorio 1; later of persons, *)apo/llwn AP9.525.7. Adv. -e/ws Hdn.Gr.1.514.

za^qerh/s, e/s, (qe/ros)
scorching, kau=ma AP6.120 (Leon.).
zaio/s: ei)=dos i)xqu/os, Hsch., cf. Plin.HN9.68 (v. zazai=os).

za^kallh/s, e/s, (ka/llos)
very beautiful, Hsch. zakelti/des, v. zek-.

za^kor-eu/w,
to be a za/koros, IG3.162.12, CIG2298 (Delos).
za^kor-i/sou (gen. sg.), name of a kind of balsam, scanned as four long syllables, Aglaïas 23 (zakoru/tion Polydorusap.Sch.).

za^/kor-os, o( and h(,
attendant in a temple (more honourable than newko/ros acc. to Philem.Lex. (cf. Philol.57.353 sqq.) in Reitzenstein
Gesch.d.Gr.Etym.p.394), z. *)afrodi/ths Hyp.Fr.178; qew=n Plu.Cam.30; *dhou=s IG3.713.1: abs., Anon.Oxy.218ii14; ta\s i(erei/as kai\ ta\s z. IG12.4.14 (v B.C.), cf. ib.7.1883 (Thespiae), Men.126, 311, IG12(2).484.21 (Mytil., late), Plu. Sull.7, etc.

za/kotos [a^], on,
exceeding wroth, Il.3.220, Theoc.25.83; of things, e)/gxos Pi.N.6.53; u(/dwr Id.Pae.9.18.

zakru^o/eis, essa, en, (kruo/eis)
very numbing, freezing, qa/natos Alc. Supp.12.8.
za/kti: kri/mnou e)n e)/tnei （-nou= e)n e)/qnei cod.) e(fqw=|, Hsch.

za^kunqi/des, ai(,= koloku/ntai,
from Zacynthus, Hsch., cf. AB 261. za/l: me/ga, i)sxuro/n, polu/, Hsch. za/la: qo/rubos, Id. zalageu=sa, f.l. for lal- or sal-, AP9.412 (Phld.). za^lai/nw, = mwrai/nw, Hsch., EM406.43. za/lakes: e)xi=noi, Hsch. zalau/da: kinou=, Id.

za^la/w, in Ep. part. zalo/wsa . . xa/laza
driving hail, Nic.Th.252.
zale/gomai, v. diale/gomai, zaeleca/man.
zalei/a, h(,= da/fnh *)alecandrei/a, Dsc.4.145.

za/leukos [a_], on,
very white, f.l. in Orac. ap. Zos.2.6 (pa/nleukos ap. Phleg.Macr.4).
za_le/w, v. zhle/w.

za/lh [a^], h(,
squall, storm, driving rain, A.Ag.656, S.Aj.352 (lyr.), etc.; koniortou= kai\ za/lhs u(po\ pneu/matos ferome/nou Pl.R.496d; za/lh| pneuma/twn by a
storm of winds, Id.Ti.43c; xeimw\n kai\ z. Hp.Insomn. 89; z. a)ne/mwn Plu.2.993e; be/lesi purpno/ou za/lhs, of the fiery rain from Aetna, A.Pr.373: metaph., za/lai
storms, distresses, Pi.O.12.12; h( tou= bi/ou z. Procop.Gaz.Ep.47; logismw=n za/lai Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.211; oi)/kou z., of women, Secund.Sent.8.
zalleu/w, Aeol. imper. 3pl. zalleu\o/nton dub. sens. in Alc. Oxy. 1789Fr.1 i marg. (= Fr.12 Lobel).

zalmo/s, o(, Thracian word for a
skin, Porph.VP14.

za/los [a^], o(,
mud, z. i)luo/eis,= borborw=des ku=ma, Nic.Th.568; za/lon （zalo/n cod.): phlo/n, Hsch.: metaph., Lib.Ep.1144.
za=los, za_lo/w, za_lwto/s, Dor. for zh=los, etc.
za/matos,= za/batos 2, Hsch.: zama/tion, to/,= tru/blion, Id. zamelh/s: me/ga me/los e)/xwn, Id.

za^men-e/w,
to put forth all one's fury, Hes.Th.928.

za^men-h/s, e/s, (me/nos) poet. Adj.
very strong, mighty, raging, h.Merc.307 (in Sup. zamene/state）; *ke/ntauros, a(/lios, Pi.P.9.38, N.4.13, cf. Sammelb.
5829.8: once in Trag., z. lo/gos word
of violence or
enmity, S.Aj.137 (anap.); also in late Ep., z. xo/los Opp.C.3.448: neut. as Adv., e)pi\ zamene\s kote/ousa Nic.Th.181:—in form za^meno/s, h/, o/n, Orac. ap. Porph.Plot.22 codd., Hsch.
zameri/tas, a, o(, Dor. word for makari/ths, Phot.

zamh=tai: megalourgoi/, Hsch. zami/lampis, a kind of
stone, Orph.L.263 (s.v.l.).
za_mi/a, za_mio/w, etc., Aeol., etc., for zhm-.
za_miorgi/a, Elean for dhmiourgi/a, Schwyzer 409.6 (vi B.C.).
*za/n, *zano/s, o(, Dor. and Ion. for *zh/n, *zhno/s, v. *zeu/s.
za^neke/ws or za^nekw=s, Adv., Aeol. for dianekw=s, cj. in Corinn.9; cf. ai)zhneke/s: dihneke/s, ai)w/nion, Hsch. zani/des: h(gemoni/des, Id.
za/pedon [a^], to/, = da/pedon, Xenoph.1.1, IG12(5).215 (Paros).

za^pi/melos [i_], on,
very fat, Hsch.

zaplhqh/s e/s, (plh/qw)
very full, z. geneia/s
a thick, full beard, A. Pers.316; z. sto/ma *mou/shs
full-sounding, AP7.75 (Antip.).

za/ploutos, on,
very rich, Hdt.1.32, E.Andr.1282, Lib.Decl.30.12, Jul.Ep.89b.

za^po/ths, ou, o(,
toper, Hsch.

za/pu^ros [a^], on, （pu=r)
very fiery, e(/likes steroph=s A.Pr.1084(anap.); pwth/mata Orac. ap. Porph. ap. Eus.PE6.3.
zarga/nh, = taini/a, Sch.Opp.H.1.100.
za/rhkes (-ike/s cod. extra ordinem): e)pi/qeton pelagw=n （-argw=n Mus.), Hsch.
za/ros, o(, a bird of prey, Sch.E.Ph.45.
zarou=n: kaqeu/dein, Hsch. zarto/s: zwmo\s tripto/s, Id. za_teu/w, zatrei=on, Dor. for zht-. zath/sasqai: ai)sqe/sqai, Id.; cf. zato/w. zato/s, v. zhto/s.
zato/w, = *fra/zw, EM408.11, cf. Hsch.:—Med. with aor. Pass.,= ai)sqa/nomai, Id. s.v. e)zatw/qh, e)zatwsa/mhn. zatra/phs, v. satra/phs.

zatrefh/s, e/s, (tre/fw) Ep. Adj.
well-fed, fat, goodly, tau/rwn zatrefe/wn Il.7.223; *fw/kas zatrefe/as Od.4.451.

zatri/kion, to/,
the game of chess, Sch.Theoc.6.18. (From Skt.
catur-a[ndot ]ga- 'four members', through Pers. and Arab.）

zauki/trofos, on, (saukro/s)
tenderly reared, Hsch. (zakki/- cod.). za^feggh/s, e/s,
very bright, Id. za^felh/s, e/s,
violent, with Adv. -lw=s, Id.; cf. e)pizafelw=s;= pa/nu a)felh/s, Suid.:—also za/felos, on, Nic. Al.556, EM408.17.

zaflegh/s, e/s, Ep. Adj.
full of fire, of men at their prime, a)/llote me/n te zaflege/es tele/qousin . . a)/llote de\ *fqinu/qousin a)kh/rioi Il.21.465; of
fiery horses, h.Hom.8.8.
shining, bright, a)/stra Orac. ap. Eus.PE3.15; se/las Nonn.D.2.26.
zafoi/taisa, v. diafoita/w.

zafo/ros, on,= polufo/ros, Hsch.:—hence zafore/w,
to be fertile, prob.l.Id. za/xma (zagma/ cod.): h(ni/a, Id.
za/xolos [a^], on, （xolh/） = za/kotos, AP9.524.7.
zaxra_h/s, e/s, prob.= za/xrhh/s, Epic.inArch.Pap.7p.6.

zaxreih/s, v.l. for zaxrhh/s. Adv. zaxreie/s
violently, Nic.Th.290.

zaxrei=os, on, (xrei/a)
very needy: c. gen., z. o(dou=
one who wants to know the way,
asks eagerly after it, Theoc.25.6.

zaxrhh/s, e/s, used only in pl.,
attacking violently, furious, raging, me/nos *bore/ao kai\ a)/llwn zaxrhw=n a)ne/mwn Il.5.525 (-xrei- most codd.); of warriors, zaxrhei=s . . kata\ krat era\s u(smi/nas 12.347, cf. 13.684; cf. zaxrah/s, zaxreih/s. (From za^- and xra/w (B); cf. e)pixra/w (B).)

za/xru_sos, on,
rich in gold, *qrh|ki/a, e)mpola/, E.Alc.498, IT1111 (lyr.): in late Prose, Lib.Or.11.140.
za/xu^tos [a^], on,= dia/xutos, Nonn.D.19.347.

za/y, h(,
surf, kari=das h( z. e)kfe/rei ki)xqu/dia Cratin.Jun.13, cf. Euph. 3, Simm.11; po/ntou . . peristei/nei a(lukh\ z. Dionys.Iamb. ap. Clem.Al. Strom.5.8.47 (who says some took z.= pu=r).
za/w, v. zw=.
*zbelsou=rdos, o(, divinity worshipped in Thrace, Rev.Ét.Gr.26.247:—also in forms *zberqou=rdos, *zbelqi- or *zberqi-ou=rdos, etc.
zbi/x (zabi/x cod.): leuko/n, Hsch. (hence kna\c zbi\x leuko/n cj. Salm. in Thespis 4; cf. knaczbi/).

za^/men-ze, inseparable Suffix, denoting
motion towards:—prop. representing -sde, as in *)aqh/naze, *qh/baze, qu/raze for *)aqh/nasde, *qh/basde, qu/rasde: but sts. found with sg. Nouns, as e)/raze, xama=ze, *)olumpi/aze, *mounuxi/aze, cf. A.D.Adv.194.18.

ze/a, h(,= zeia/, D.H.2.25, Dsc.2.89 (v.l. zeia/): nom. sg. ze/h PPetr. 2p.69 (iii B.C.). = libanwti\s ka/rpimos, Dsc.3.74.
the roof of a horse's mouth, Hippiatr.1,8. (With ze/a 1, cf. Skt.
yávas (masc.), Lith.
javaĩ (masc. pl.) 'corn'.)

zege/ries, oi(, a Libyan word,= bounoi/, but used as a name for a kind of
mouse, Hdt.4.192; zegeri/ai, Hsch.

zeia/, h(, usu. in pl. zeiai/ (sg., v. infr.),
one-seeded wheat, Triticum monococcum, used as fodder for horses, Hom. only in Od.; pa\r d' e)/balon zeia/s, a)na\ de\ kri= leuko\n e)/meican 4.41, cf. 604; in Il. o)/lurai, e.g. i(/ppoi . . kri= leuko\n e)repto/menoi kai\ o)lu/ras 5.196, 8.564; a)po\ o)lure/wn poieu=ntai siti/a (sc. oi( *ai)gu/ptioi）, ta\s zeia\s metece/teroi kale/ousi Hdt. 2.36, cf. Eup.14 D., X.An.5.4.27, Str.15.1.18, Asclep. ap. Gal.13.257: in sg., zeia\ a(plh= Dsc.2.89 (v.l. ze/a),= Gal.6.517.
rice-wheat, in sg., Thphr.HP8.9.2, al. (where o)/lura is a cultural variety); z. di/kokkos,
Triticum dicoccum, Dsc. l.c. (v.l. ze/a), Gal. l.c.
zeiga/rh: te/ttic para\ *sidh/tais, Hsch.

zei/dwros, on,
zea-giving (Plin.HN18.82, EM410.6), as epith. of the earth, zei/dwros a)/roura Il.2.548, Od.3.3, Hes.Op.173; z. a)rdmo/s Nonn.D.26.185: c. gen., z. o)pw/rhs a)xra/s AP9.4 (Cyllen.): also in late Prose, Hld.9.22 (ze（v）e/-dwros, cf. ze/a). some authors derived it from za/w,= bio/dwros (so expld. by Hsch.),
life-giving, *)afrodi/th Emp.151; *)he/lios Nonn.D.12.23, cf. 22.276. zei/zin,
mamma, Gloss.
zeili/auros, = a)nagalli\s kuanh=, Ps.-Dsc.2.178. ze/i+nos, v. zh=nos.
zei/numen (-amen cod.): sbe/nnumen, Hsch. zeipi/tis: o( perixu/ths, Id. (zeipoi/ths Gramm. in Reitzenstein Ind.Lect.Rost.1892/3p.10).

zeira/, h(,
a wide upper garment, girded about the loins and falling over the feet, worn by Arabians, Hdt.7.69; by Thracians, ib.75, X.An.7.4.4: zirai/ Hsch.; but zeira/ is prescribed by Gramm. in Reitzenstein Ind.Lect.Rost.1892/3p.10.

zeiratei/s: i(ma/tio/n ti *su/rwn, Hsch. zeirei=n: a)rwmatopoiei=n, Id. zeiro/n: poiki/lon, Id. zei=ros, a kind of
grape, Id.

zeirofo/ros, on,
wearing a zeira/, *)ai/+dhs Antim.88. zeirofo/rous: zwnofo/rous, Hsch. (xwn-cod.).
zei/w, late Ep. for ze/w, A.R.1.734, Call.Dian.60.

zekamnai/a, a(, Elean for deka-,
sum of ten minae, Schwyzer 409.7 (vi B.C.).
zekelti/des (v.l. zak- as in Hsch.), ai(, Boeot. for gogguli/des or koloku/ntai, Nic.etc. ap. Ath.9.369a.
zela=s, o(, gen. and dat. zela/, Thracian word,= oi)=nos, Choerob.in Theod.1.145: but dat. tw=| zh=la Eup.（Fr.355) ibid., cf. Hsch.s.v. zi/lai, Phot. s.v. zeila (sic).
ze/lkia: la/xana (Phryg.), Hsch. (ze/lmia poscit ordo): ze/lkeia: la/xana para\ *fruci\ ta\ par' h(mi=n lego/mena *fru/gia Gramm. in Reitzenstein Ind.Lect.Rost.1892/3p.9.
ze/llw, aor. 2 e)/zelon, Arc. for ba/llw, Hsch., EM408.42.

ze/ma, atos, to/, (ze/w)
fermentation, Herasap.Gal.13.1044: metaph.,
lewdness, LXXJd.20.6.
boiling, e)ndou\s ze/ma bringing it to
the boil, Herasap.Gal.13.548; do\s ze/ma keep it on
the boil, Orib.Fr.113; o)/rnis a)po\ ze/matos a
boiled fowl, Alex.Trall.Febr.1.
that which is boiled, decoction, Dsc.Alex.7, Gp.8.37.3:—also ze/mma, LXX Ez.24.13.
ze/melen: ba/rbaron a)ndra/podon (Phryg.), Hsch.
ze/nnu_mi, = ze/w, Philagr. ap. Orib.5.17.7, PHolm.15.22（Pass.),al.: —Pass., Dsc.2.70, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.104.

zeo-poi/ion, to/,
mill for grinding ze/a, prob. in AB261.

zeo/-pu_ron, to/, (ze/a, puro/s) a variety of
Triticum monococcum, Gal.6.515.
ze/reqron, to/, Arc. for be/reqron, ba/raqron, Str.8.8.4.
ze/rna, h(,= ku/peiros, Gp.2.6.23.

zeselaiopa^gh/s, e/s,
cooked in boiling oil, Philox.3.18.

ze/sis, ews, h(, (ze/w)
seething, effervescence, boiling, Pl.Ti.66b, Ocell. 2.9, etc.; xolh=s Gal.16.577; ou)/rwn ib.661; o(/tan e(yhqh=| me/xri ze/sews up to
boiling heat, Plu.2.690c: metaph., z. th=s yuxh=s Pl.Cra.419e; [o)rgh\] z. tou= peri\ kardi/an ai(/matos Arist.de An.403a31.

zesta/krata, ta/, (zesto/s, a)/kraton)
hot wine, Pall.in Hp.2.162 D.

zestolousi/a, h(,
washing in hot water, Theonap.Gal.6.208,212.

zesto/s, h/, o/n, (ze/w)
seethed, boiled, kre/a z. kai\ o)pta/ App.Hisp. 85.
hot, u(/dwr Nic.Fr.70.11, Dsc.1.33, Sor.1.50; u(/data z., of hot springs, Str.12.8.17; opp. xliaro/s, S.E.P.1.101; ya/mmos D.L.6.23; li/qos Ps.-Plu.Fluv.1.2; ei) de\ -ote/ras kra/sews de/ointo if they want the oil-bath
hotter, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.10.37.12: metaph., xliaro\s ei)= kai\ ou)/te z. ou)/te yuxro/s Apoc.3.15.

zesto/ths, htos, h(,
heat, Paus.10.11.4.
zetrai/a, h(, Thracian for xu/tra, Poll.10.95.

zeuga/rion [a^], to/, Dim.of zeu=gos,
a puny pair or
team, esp. of oxen, Ar.Av.582; z. boeiko/n Id.Fr.109; booi=n ib.387, cf. PCair.Zen.251.7 (iii B.C.).
zeu/gela: dia/broxa cu/la: kai\ tw=n bow=n h)\ h(mio/nwn zeukta/: kai\ te/maxos e)k pleura=s h(lisme/nhs, Hsch.
zeugela/ths [a^], ou, o(,= zeughla/ths, Hsch.

zeughl-a^si/a, h(,
the driving a yoke of oxen, Eust.361.13.

zeughl-a^te/w,
drive a yoke of oxen, X.An.6.1.9, Dialex.7.2.

zeughl-a/ths [a^], ou, o(,
the driver of a yoke of oxen, teamster, S.Fr.616, X.An.6.1.8, PFay.112.6 (i A.D.), Dialex.7.2: pl., D.S.31.24:—a fem. zeughl-a^tri/s, i/dos, S.Fr.878.

zeugi/zw,
yoke in pairs, unite, in Pass., PGrenf.1.1.1(ii B.C.), LXX 1 Ma.1.15,Aq.Nu.25.3.
zeugi/pphs, ou, o(, in pl., dub. l. in D.S.19.106 (leg. zeugi/tas).

zeugi/s, i/dos, h(,
rope, BGU544.5 (ii A.D.).

zeugi/sion, to/,
rating of the zeugi=tai, z. telei=n Arist.Ath.7.4, cf. Poll.8.130.

zeugi/ths [i_], ou, o(, fem. zeugi=tis, idos, (zeu=gos)
yoked in pairs, zeugi/tides i(/ppoi Call.Ap.48; h(mi/onoi zeugi=tai D.S.17.71; of soldiers,
in the same rank, Plu.Pel.23; ka/lamos z. a reed
of which were made the mouthpieces of the double flutes (zeu/gh), Thphr.HP4.11.3. zeugi=tai, oi(, the third of Solon's four classes of Athenian citizens, so called from
their being able to keep a team (zeu=gos)
of oxen, Arist.Pol. 1274a20, Ath.4.3, Lexap.D.43.54, IG12.45.40, etc.
zeu=gla^, h(, poet. for sq., a)/ths E.Fr.285.10, cf. Lyr.Alex.Adesp.11.8, AP9.19 (Arch.), Choerob.in Theod.1.304.

zeu/gl-h, h(,
loop attached to the yoke (zugo/n), through which the beasts' heads were put, xai/th zeu/glhs e)ceripou=sa para\ zugo/n Il.17.440; e)/zeuca . . e)n zugoi=si knw/dala zeu/glaisi douleu/onta A.Pr.463; u(podu/ntes u(po\ th\n z. Hdt.1.31; bo/as zeu/gla| pe/lassen Pi.P.4.227; u(pa/gein tou\s i(/ppous th=| z. Luc.DMar.6.2. = zeu=gos 1.1, BGU1507 (iii B.C.).—Not found in good Att. Prose.
cross-bar of the double rudder, E.Hel.1536.
zeu/gl-hqen, Adv., for e)k th=s zeu/glhs, A.R.3.1319.
zeu/gl-hfi, Ep. gen. or dat. of zeu/glh, Call.Dian.162.
zeuglo/desmon, to/,= zugo/desmon, Hsch.

zeu=gma, atos, to/, (zeu/gnumi)
that which is used for joining, band, bond, to\ z. tou= lime/nos the
barrier of ships moored across the mouth of the harbour, Th.7.69, cf. 70, D.S.13.14:—written zeogma, Rev.Phil.50.70 (Didyma, ii B.C.).
bridge of boats, AP9.147 (Antag.); ta\ z. tw=n potamw=n D.H.9.31, cf. Plu.2.174e, etc.;
pier or
platform formed by lashing several vessels together, Plb.3.46.2, Plu.Marc.14, 15.
canal-lock, PPetr.2p.123, 3p.210 (iii B.C.): metaph., zeu/gmat' a)na/gkhs
the bonds of necessity, E.IA443. Gramm.,
zeugma, a figure of speech, wherein two subjects are used jointly with the same predicate, which strictly belongs only to one, Alex. Fig.2.17.

zeugmatiko/n, to/,
lock-toll, PLond.3.1157.6, al. (iii A.D.), POxy. 2129.4, al. (iii A.D.).

zeu/gnu_mi, zeu/gnu_si A.Pers.191, (u(po-) Pl.Plt.309a; 2pl. imper. zeu/gnu^te E.Rh.33 (lyr.); inf. -u/nai （meta-) X.Cyr.6.3.21, Ep. zeugnu=men Il.16.145; part. zeugnu/s Hdt.1.206, 4.89; impf. 3pl. e)zeu/gnu^san Id.7.33, Ep. zeu/gn- Il.24.783: also zeugnu/w Hdt.1.205, Plb.5.52.4, etc.: impf. e)zeu/gnuon Hdt.4.89 (Ep. zeu/gn- v.l. Il.19.393): fut. zeu/cw Pi.I.1.6, etc.: aor. 1 e)/zeuca Od.3.478, etc.: late pf. e)/zeuxa （e)p-) Philostr.VA2.14:—Med., Ep. impf. 3dual zeugnu/sqhn Il.24.281, 3pl. e)zeu/gnunto Od.3.492: fut. zeu/comai E.Hec.469(lyr.), etc.: aor. 1 e)zeuca/mhn Hdt.3.102, E.Ion901 (lyr.):—Pass., fut. zeuxqh/somai （dia-) Gal.9.938: aor.1 e)zeu/xqhn Pi.O.3.6, Hdt.7.6, A.Ag.842, Pl.Plt.302e: more commonly aor. 2 e)zu/ghn [u^] Pi.N.7.6, E.Supp.822 (lyr.), (su-) Pl.R.546c: pf. e)/zeugmai Il.18.276: plpf. e)/zeukto Hdt.4.85.—Usu. in aor. Act. in Hom.: the simple Verb is rare in Att. Prose:—
yoke, put to, u(p' o)/xesfin i(/ppous Il.23.130; u(f' a(/rmasin i(/ppous 24.14; u(p' a)ma/ch|sin bo/as h(mio/nous te ib.783; ka)/zeuca prw=tos e)n zugoi=si knw/dala A.Pr.462:—Med. (esp. in Od.), i(/ppous zeu/gnusqai
put to one's horses, Od.3.492, al.: abs., zeugnu/sqhn Il.24.281; zeu/comai a)=ra pw/lous E.Hec. 469(lyr.); kamh/lous Hdt.3.102; of riding horses,
harness, saddle and bridle, zeu=cai *pa/gason Pi.O.13.64, cf.Ar.Pax128, 135; of chariots,
put to, get ready, z. a(/rma, o)/xous, Pi.P.10.65, E.Andr.1020(lyr.):—Med., te/qrippa Id.Alc.428.
bind fast, a)skou\s desmoi=s X.An.3.5.10: —Pass., fa/rh . . e)zeugme/nai po/rpaisin
having them
fastened . . , E.El. 317. metaph., po/tmw| zugei/s
in the yoke of fate, Pi.N.7.6; zugei\s e)n a(/rmasi phma/twn A.Ch.795(lyr.); a)na/gkh| zugei/s S.Ph.1025; zeu/xqh
was tamed, Id.Ant.955 (lyr.); qesfa/tois . . zugei/s E.Supp.220; o(rki/oisi z. Id.Med.735; monarxi/a zeuxqei=sa e)n gra/mmasin a)gaqoi=s Pl.Plt.302e: —Med., to/nd' e)n o(/rkois zeu/comai E.Supp.1229.
join together, sani/des . . makrai\ e)u/+cestoi e)zeugme/nai
well-joined, Il.18.276 (elsewh. in Hom. only in signf. 1); zeu=cai o)do/ntas, in setting a fractured jaw, Hp.Art. 32; tw\ po/de zeugnu/ntes, of sculptors who made their statues with
joined feet, Hld.3.13.
join in wedlock, e)peida\n eu)fro/nh zeu/ch| mi/a
yokes her
in wedlock, S.Fr.583.11; of the parents or authors of the marriage, ti/s tau/thn e)/zeuce; E.IA698; z. th\n qugate/ra tini/ App. BC2.14, cf. Ath.12.554d:—in Med., of the husband,
wed, a)/koitin zeu/casqai E.Alc.994(lyr.); parqe/neion e)zeu/cw le/xos Id.Tr.676 (so in Act., ga/mois e)/zeuc' *)adra/stou pai=da I
married his daughter, Id.Ph. 1366; o( *seme/lhn zeu/cas ga/mois Id.Ba.468):—Pass.,
to be married, e)zeugme/nh, opp. ko/rh, S.Tr.536; ga/mois zeuxqh=nai or zugh=nai, Id.OT 826, E.IA907, etc.; e)n ga/mois Id.El.99; e)s a)ndro\s eu)na/n Id.Supp.822 (lyr.): metaph., z. me/los e)/rgmasi Pi.N.1.7, cf.I.1.6.
join opposite banks
by bridges, potamo\n zeu=cai Hdt.1.206; to\n *(ellh/sponton Id.7.33, Lys.2.29; mhxanai=s e)/zeucen *(/ellhs porqmo/n A.Pers.722 (troch.):—also in Med., zeu/gnusqai to\n *bo/sporon Hdt.4.83 (v.l. -nu/nai):—Pass., Id.7.6, 34; diw=ruc e)zeugme/nh ploi/ois X.An.1.2.5; but also, gefu/ras zeu=cai Hdt.1.205, cf. 4.85, 118,al.
furnish ships
with cross-benches (zugo/n 111), Hes.Fr.76.6; but zeu/cantes ta\s palaia\s [nau=s] w(/ste plwi/+mous ei)=nai
having strengthened them
with thwarts, Th.1.29, cf. Sch. ad loc.
pair or
match gladiators, Arr.Epict.1.29.37.
join issue at law, in Pass., [di/kai] u(pe/r tinos e)zeugme/nai SIG742.44 (Ephesus, i B.C.). (Cf. Skt.
yunákti, pl.
yuñjánti 'yoke', Lat.
jungo, jugum.）

zeugopoii/a, h(,
the making of mouthpieces for double flutes, Thphr. HP4.11.6.

zeu=gos, eos, to/, (zeu/gnumi)
yoke of beasts, pair or
team of mules, oxen or
horses, Il.18.543, IG5(2).3.1 (Arc., iv B.C.), etc.; z. i(/ppwn And. 4.26.
carriage drawn by a yoke of beasts, a chariot, zeu/gei+ komi/zesqai Hdt.1.31; e)pi\ zeuge/wn e)la/sasai ib.199; e)pi\ zeu/gous a)/gein And. 1.45; tw=| zeu/gei o(\ h)=gen th\n gunai=ka Hyp.Lyc.5;
wagons, zeu/gesi tou\s li/qous a)/gousi SIG124 (iv B.C.); boeika/ Th.4.128;
racing-car,= te/qrippon, Id.5.50; z. te/qrippon A.Fr.346; h)\ sunwri/di h)\ zeu/gei neni/khken Pl.Ap.36d (but = sunwri/s, Plu.2.146d); z. mi/sqion a hired
chariot, Id.Ant.6; leuko\n z.
with white
horses, D.21.158.
pair or
couple of any things, i)rh/kwn, ai)gupiw=n, Hdt.3.76; pede/wn ib.130; *)atreida=n A. Ag.44 (anap.); e)mba/dwn Ar.Eq.872, cf. Herod.7.51; e)nwti/wn BGU 1050.9 (Aug.), etc.; kera/mou IG12.313.23, al.; [kera/mwn] SIG245 Gi36 (Delph., iv B.C.); qurw=n IG12.313.110; taw(=n Antiph.205; kallipu/gwn Cerc.14: abs.,
married couple, to\ z., o(\ kalei=tai qh=lu kai\ a)/rren X.Oec. 7.18; to\ e)rwtiko\n z. Luc.Am.11; kata\ zeu=gos in
pairs, Plu.2.93d; e)s zeu/gea Luc.Syr.D.12.
mouthpiece of a double flute, Thphr.HP 4.11.4,6. z. i(mati/wn
suit of clothes, BGU814.9(iii A.D.). incorrectly also of
more than two things or
persons joined together, z. tripa/rqenon three maiden sisters, of the Graces, E.Fr.357; so z. tri/doulon Ar.Fr.576; z. nekrw=n, where parents and children are spoken of, E.HF454. = Lat.
jugerum, Cod.Just.10.27.2.8.

zeugotrof-e/w,
keep a yoke of beasts, Poll.8.132.

zeugo/trof-os, on,
keeping a yoke of beasts, IG22.1576.73 (iv B.C.), Plu.Per.12.

zeugofore/omai, Pass.,
to be drawn by a yoke of oxen, cj. in Ph. Bybl. ap. Eus.PE1.10 (zug- codd.).

zeugw=xos, o(, (e)/xw)
owner of a zeu=gos, IG4.742.8 (Hermione).
zeu/k-teira, h(, fem. from sq., of Aphrodite, Orph.H.55.3.

zeuk-th/r, h=ros, o(,
one who yokes or
joins: hence Adj. z. i(ma/ntes the straps
of the yoke, J.AJ12.4.6, cf. Hsch. s.v. zeu/glas.

zeuk-th/rios, a, on,
fit for joining or
yoking, ge/fura gai=n duoi=n z. A.Pers.736 (troch.); pa/ter . . *maina/dwn zeukth/rie Id.Fr.382. as Subst., zeukth/rion, to/,= zugo/n,
yoke, Id.Ag.529, POxy.934.5 (iii A.D.); zeukthri/a, h(,= zeu/glh 11, Act.Ap.27.40.

zeuk-th\s laou=, gloss on zeuci/lews, Hsch. (prob. for zeukto\s lao/s cod.); =
junctor, Gloss.
zeuk-tiko/s, h/, o/n,= eu)nai=os, of Aphrodite, Sch.Opp.H.4.156; = zeukth/rios, h(ni/ai Gloss.

zeukto/s, h/, o/n, (zeu/gnumi)
yoked, harnessed, Plu.2.278b, etc.;
joined in pairs, ka/lamoi Pl.Epigr.24.4; sti/xos h(rw/|w| z. podi/, of the pentameter, AP7.9 (Damag.).
joined, porqmo\s gefu/ra| zeukto/s Str. 10.2.8. zeukto/n, to/,= zeu=gos 1.2, Sor.1.49, prob. in Aët.9.30.
zeu/man: th\n phgh/n (Phryg.), Hsch.

zeuci/ga^mos [i^], h(,
she that yokes in marriage, epith. of the planet Venus, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.173.
*zeucidi/a, epith. of Hera at Argos, EM409.28.

zeuci/lews [i^], w, o(,
subjugator of men, of a king, S.Fr.133.

zeu/cippos,
desultor, junctor, Gloss.

zeu=cis, ews, h(, (zeu/gnumi)
yoking or
manner of yoking oxen, zeu/ci toiau/th| xrew/menoi Hdt.3.104.
bridging, tou= *bospo/rou Id.4.88; tou= *(ellhspo/ntou Id.7.35.

*zeu/s, o(, nom. Il.1.175, al., once written *zhu/s IG12(3).1313 (Thera), but *zeu/s ib.1316, al.; Boeot. *deu/s (q.v.); voc. *zeu= Il.1.503, etc.; gen. *divo/s BMus.Inscr.952 (Cephallenia, vi B.C.), *dio/s Il.1.63, etc.; dat. *divi/ Schwyzer 80 (Argive, from Olympia, v B.C.), *dii/ Il.1.578, al., IG12.80.12 (v B.C.), etc., contr. *di/ [i_] Pi.O.13.106, SIG9,35 (Elis, vi B.C., Syrac., v B.C., from Olympia); late *dei/+ JHS32.167 (Pisidia), etc.; acc. *di/a, rarer than *dio/s, *dii/ in Hom. (Il.1.394, al.), freq. later (cf. Skt.
dyaús, gen.
divás, loc.
diví 'sky', 'heaven', 'day', loc. also
dyávi,= Lat. Jove, acc.
dyā´m,= Lat.
diem,= Gr. *zh=n (v. infr.)): also nom. *zh/n prob. in A.Supp.162 (lyr.); gen. dat. acc. *zhno/s, *zhni/, *zh=na, Il.4.408, 2.49, 14.157, al., freq. in Trag. (Com. only in Trag. phrases); Coan *zhni/ SIG1025.24 (iv/iii B.C.); acc. *zh=n （*zh=n' Aristarch.) Il.8.206, 14.265, 24.331, Hes.Th.884, at end of verse, before vowel in next verse (stem *zhn- prob. originated in acc. sg.); Cret. *tthno/s, *tthni/, GDI5024.23, 77, *th=na, *thni/, ib.5039.11, 5145.12, *dh=na SIG527.17 (iii B.C.); nom. *dh/n Hdn.Gr.2.911:—Dor. and Att.-Ion. forms with a (of doubtful origin), nom. *za/n Pythag. ap. Porph.VP17, Ar.Av.570; gen. *zano/s Schwyzer 696 (Chios, iv B.C.), Cerc.1.7, Philox.3.10, IG5(1).407 (Sparta, ii A.D.); *zano/s and *zani/, Lyr.Adesp. 82A, B (Ionic); acc. *za=na Call.Fr.10.6P., cf. Euhem.24J. (FGrH 63); nom. *za/s Pherecyd.Syr.1, 2 (*zh/s ap.Hdn.Gr. l.c.), *za/s *zanto/s Choerob. in Theod.1.116; *da/n (q. v.); *ta/n Head Hist.Num.2469 (Crete); nom. *di/s Rhinth.14, Hdn.Gr. l.c.:—obl. cases *zeo/s, *zei/+, *ze/a, cited by S.E.M.1.177, 195; *zeu=n f.l. for *zh=n' Aeschrio 8.5: the pl. *di/es, *di/as, *diw=n, *disi/, Ael.Dion.Fr.127; tou\s kthsi/ous *di/as Ath. 11.473b; *di/es kai\ *zh=nes Stoic.2.191; Elean *za=nes Paus.5.21.2:— Zeus, the sky-god, u)/ei me\n o) Z. Alc.34, cf. SIG93.34 (v B.C.), Thphr. Char.14.12, etc.; *zeu= a)/lloi te qeoi/ Il.6.476; w)= *zeu= kai\ pa/ntes qeoi/, w)= *zeu= kai\ qeoi/, X.Cyr.2.2.10, Ar.Pl.1, etc.; *zeu= *zeu= A.Ch.246, Ar.V.323 (lyr., prob. l.); w)= *zeu= basileu=, th=s lepto/thtos tw=n frenw=n Id.Nu.153; in oaths, ou) ma\ *zh=na, twice in Hom., Il.23.43, Od.20.339: freq. in Com. and Prose, ou) ma\ *di/a Ar.V.193, Pl.R.426b (c.Art., ma\ to\n *di/', ou) Ar.V.169, al.); nai\ ma\ *di/a Id.Ach.88, X.Mem.2.7.14; nh\ to\n *di/a or nh\ *di/a, Ar.V.217, Eq.319, etc.; cf. nhdi/; pro\s tou= *dio/s Id.Av.130; pro\s *dio/s X.An.5.7.32; ou) to\n *di/a alone, Ar.Lys.986: prov. of enormous wealth, tw=| *dii\ plou/tou pe/ri e)ri/zein Hdt.5.49. of other deities, *z. kataxqo/nios,= *plou/twn, Il.9.457; *z. xqo/nios S.OC1606, SIG1024.25 (Myconos, iii/ii B.C.); of non-Greek divinities, *z. *)/ammwn Pi.P. 4.16, etc.; freq. of Semitic Baalim, Z. *beelbw/swros, etc., OGI620 (Gerasa, i A.D.)), etc.; Z. *)wroma/sdhs,= Pers.Ahuramazda, ib.383.41 (Nemrud Dagh, i B.C.). of persons, o( sxinoke/falos Z., iron. of Pericles, Cratin.71; in flattery of kings, Hdt.7.56 (of Xerxes); *ce/rchs o( tw=n *persw=n Z. Gorg.Fr.5aD.; [i(ereu\s] *seleu/kou *dio\s *nika/toros OGI245.10 (ii B.C.); of the Roman emperors, Opp.C.1.3; *ne/rwn Z. *)eleuqe/rios IG7.2713.41 (Acraephiae), etc.; *zh=na to\n *ai)nea/dhn AP9.307 (Phil.). *dio\s a)sth/r the
planet Jupiter, Pl.Epin. 987c, Arist.Mete.343b30, etc.; so *zeu/s Placit.2.32.1, Cleom.2.7; *dio\s h(me/ra a day of the week, D.C.37.19. Pythag. name for the
monad, Theol.Ar.12.
zeu/sasqai: geu/sasqai, Hsch.
zefu^r-h/i+os, on,= zefu/rios, Nonn.D.48.517.

zefu^r-hi/+s, i/+dos, pecul.fem. of zefu/rios, a)kth/ Posidipp. ap. Ath.7.318d codd. (-i/tidos Valck.).
of the god Zephyros, gene/qlh Nonn.D.37.335, cf.47.341.

zefu^r-i/h (sc. pnoh/), h(,= *ze/furos,
the west wind, Od.7.119. [*zef-long metri gr.]
zefu^r-iko/s, h/, o/n,= sq., Arist.Mete.364a20, Thphr.HP8.7.7.

zefu^/r-ios, on, sts. also a, on (cf. *zefuri/h),
of the West or
west wind, westerly, Id.CP2.3.1; toi=s z. (sc. a)ne/mois)
at the period of westwinds, Arist.HA618a7;
western, toi=xos Inscr.Délos 290.166 (iii B.C.), cf. IG12(5).126 (Paros, ii B.C.). w)|o\n z.
wind-egg, also a)nemiai=on, u(phne/mion, Arist.HA560a6, GA749b1. *z. a)/kra or *zefu/rion, to/, name of a cape in Cyprus, Str.14.6.3, Ath.7.318d: *zefu/rion, to/, cape in S. Italy, Str.6.1.7.

zefu^r-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,= foreg. 1, epith. of the month of March, Lyd.Mens.4.152: fem. zefu^r-i=tis, idos, h(,= foreg. 1, au)=rai Orph.H.81.1; = foreg. 111, epith. of Aphrodite, as worshipped in Cyprus, Call.Epigr.6; cf. zefurhi/+s 1.

*ze/fu^ros, o(, any
westerly wind, *bore/hs kai\ *z., tw/ te *qrh/|khqen a)/hton Il.9.5: coupled with *no/tos, 21.334; opp. *eu)=ros, Od.5.332, 19.206; *z. dusah/s, e)/fudros, 5.295, 14.458; yuxro/s Arist.Pr.946a17; but eu)dieino\s kai\ h(/distos ib.943b21; o(po/te ne/fea *z. stufeli/ch| Il.11.305; a(/ma pnoih=| *zefu/roio qe/oimen, of horses, 19.415; later,
the due West wind, opp. a)phliw/ths, Arist.Mete.363b12, cf.Mu.394b26; but rather
northwest in Id.Pol.1290a19. (Prob. cogn. with zo/fos, cf. zofo/pnoia.)

ze/w, contr. 3sg. zei= even in Il.21.362; later Ep. zei/w Call.Dian. 60, subj. zei/h|si Epic. in Arch.Pap.7p.7; in late Prose ze/nnumi (q.v.): impf. ze/e Il.21.365, e)/zee Hes.Th.695, e)/zei S.OC434: fut. ze/sw （e)cana-) A.Pr.372: aor. e)/zesa Hdt.7.188, cf. e)pize/w; Ep. ze/ssa Il.18.349:—Pass., aor. e)ze/sqhn （a)p-) Dsc.1.3, (e)n-) Aret.CA1.2: pf. e)/zesmai Gp.10.54.3:—
boil, seethe, of water, e)pei\ dh\ ze/ssen u(/dwr e)ni\ h)/nopi xalkw=| Il.18.349, Od.10.360; w(s de\ le/bhs zei= e)/ndon as the kettle
boils, Il.21.362, cf. E.Cyc.343; rarely of solids,
to be fiery hot, xqw\n e)/zee Hes.Th.695,847; xalko/s Call. l.c.
ferment, Hp.VM11; gleu/kous ze/ontos Dsc.5.8. metaph.,
boil or
bubble up, th=s qala/sshs zesa/shs Hdt.7.188; ai(=ma dia\ xrwto\s ze/ss' AP7.208 (Anyte); oi)=nos zei= Pl.Lg.773d. of passion, o(phni/k' e)/zei qumo/s S.OC434, cf. Pl.R.440c, etc.; to\ ze/on th=s ma/xhs Hld.1.33. c. gen.,
boil up or
over with a thing, li/mnh ze/ousa u(/datos kai\ phlou= Pl.Phd.113a; pi/qos z. [oi)/nou] Thphr.HP9.17.3; pedi/a zei/ont' *)agarhnw=n
boiling, teeming with . . , APl.4.39 (Arab.); of persons, z. skwlh/kwn Luc.Alex.59: c. dat., z. fqeiri/ Id.Sat.26; z. flogmw=| Lyc.690; qa/latta ai(/uati kai\ r(oqi/w| ze/ousa Aristid.1.142J. causal,
make to boil, boil, toi\ de\ loetra\ puri\ ze/on A.R.3.273; qumo\n e)pi\ *troi/h| po/son e)/zesas; AP7.385 (Phil.).
exhale, a)u+tmh/n (v.l. -mh=|) A.R.1.734. (ze/（s）-w, cf. zes-to/s, Skt.
yásati 'boil', OHG.
jësan 'ferment', 'foam', Engl.
yeast.）
zh=, zh=qi, imper. of zw= (q.v.). zhbh/nh, v. zibu/nh.

zhl-ai=os, a, on, (zh=los)
jealous, AP9.524.7.

zhl-a/s,
paelex, Gloss.
zhl-euth/s, ou=, o(,= zhlwth/s in vulgar language, Eust.1527.34.
zhl-eu/w, = zhlo/w, Democr.55 (v.l.), Simp.in Epict.p.56D.

zhl-e/w, = zhlotupe/w, etym. of zhlh/mwn, Eust.70.30:—in Dor. form za_le/w,
to be zealous for, ta\ ta=s au)tosautou= patri/dos SIG734.7 (Delph., i B.C.).

zh/l-h, h(,
female rival, X.Eph.2.11, Aristaenet.1.25 codd.
zhlhm-osu/nh, h(, poet. for zh=los, Q.S.13.388 (pl.).

zhlh/m-wn, on, gen. onos, (zhle/w)
jealous, sxe/tlioi/ e)ste, qeoi/, zhlh/mones e)/coxon a)/llwn Od.5.118; and late Ep., as Call.Dian.30, Opp.C.3.191, Musae.36, 37; mh=nis AP3.7 (Inscr. Cyzic.).

zhlo-eoth/r, h=ros, o(,
giver of bliss, AP9.524.7.

zhlo-ma^nh/s, e/s,
mad with jealousy, ko/lasma ib.5.217 (Agath.), cf. Nonn.D.41.211.

zh=los, ou, o(, later eos, to/, Ep.Phil.3.6 codd. opt.; Dor. za=los IG12 (5).891, etc.:—
jealousy (= fqo/nos), Hes.Op.195, S.OT1526: coupled with fqo/nos by Democr.191, Lys.2.48, Pl.Phlb.47e, 50c, Lg. 679c(pl.); ei)s zh=lon i)e/nai Id.R.550e: more usu. in good sense,
eager rivalry, emulation, Id.Mx.242a, Arist.Rh.1388a30. c. gen. pers.,
zeal for one, cunai/mwn S.OC943; kata\ zh=lon *(hrakle/ous in
emulation of him, Plu.Thes.25; z. pro/s tina Luc.Dem.Enc.57: abs.,
passion, PGrenf.1.1.13 (ii B.C.). c. gen. rei, zh=lon . . ga/mwn e)/xousa causing
rivalry for my hand, E.Hec.352; z. a)zh/lwn kai\ fo/bon a)fo/bwn Phld.Oec.p.66J.; z. tw=n a)ri/stwn
emulous desire for . . , opp. fugh\ tw=n xeiro/nwn, Luc.Ind.17; a)ndragaqi/as Plu.Cor.4; so z. pro/s ti Phld.Rh.2.53S., Plu.Per.2; z. peri\ ta\ stratiwtika/ Str.14.2.27: pl.,
ambitions, Phld.Rh.2.54S.
fervour, zeal, LXX 4 Ki.19.31, al., 1 Ep.Cor.14.1,al.;
indignation, z. puro/s Ep.Hebr.10.27. personified as son of Styx, brother of *bi/a, *kra/tos, *ni/kh, Hes.Th. 384.
pride, honour, glory, S.Aj.503; z. kai\ xara/ D.18.217; to\n au)to\n e)/xei zh=lon o( ste/fanos, ib.120; zh=lon kai\ timh\n fe/rei th=| po/lei Id.23.64, cf. 18.273, 60.33.
spirit, th=s politei/as Plb.4.27.8: pl.,
tastes, interests, toi=s a)po\ diafo/rwn e)pithdeuma/twn, bi/wn, zh/lwn, h(likiw=n, Longin.7.4. esp. in Lit. Crit.,
style, tou= *)asianou= legome/nou zh/lou Str.14.1.41, cf. Plu.Ant.2.
zhlosu/nh, h(, poet. for zh=los, h.Ap.100.

zhlotu^p-e/w,
to be jealous of, c. acc., zhlotupw=n me kai\ fqonw=n Pl. Smp.213d; th\n au(tou= gunai=ka Ath.12.532a, cf. POxy.472.11 (ii A.D.); z. dou/lhn e)pi\ tw=| a)ndri/ in regard to her husband, Plu.2.267d: c. dat.,
emulate, z. tini\ e)painoume/nw| Demetr.Eloc.292:—Pass., h( -oume/nh memoixeu=sqai Ph.1.141.
envy, Cic.Att.13.18.2 (Pass., ib.13.1); z. tina/ tinos Jul.Or.5.167c. c.acc. rei,
regard with jealous anger, ta\ gigno/mena Aeschin.1.58.
pretend to, affect, ka/qarma zhlotupou=n a)reth/n Id.3.211;
imitate, follow, th\n *qa/lhtos do/can Suid. s.v. *fereku/dhs :—Pass., h( zhlotupoume/nh turanni/s Plu.Arat.25.

zhlotu^p-i/a, h(,
jealousy, rivalry, envy, Aeschin.3.81, Com.Adesp.16.20D.; z. kai\ fqo/nos th=s do/chs Plu.Per.10; h( kata\ th\n te/xnhn z. Luc.Cal.2; z. pro/s tina Plu.2.276b; qusi/a zhlotupi/as LXXNu.5.15: pl., Phld.Rh.2.139S.

zhlo/tu^p-os, on, (tu/ptw)
jealous, Ar.Pl.1016, Men.Pk.409, J.AJ 5.8.2, etc.; title of mime by Herodas; z. o)du/nai AP5.151 (Mel.); to\ z. Phld.Hom.p.41 O. Adv. -pws Str.14.1.20; z. e)/xein dia\ to\n e)/rwta J.BJ1.22.3; pro/s tina Aeschin.Socr.Oxy.1608.83: Sup. -w/tata, diateqh=nai pro/s tina Ael.VH12.16.
eager, pro\s th\n tw=n a)rre/nwn sunousi/an Ptol.Tetr.62.

zhl-o/w, (zh=los): c. acc. pers.,
vie with, emulate, tina Th.2.37, Pl.R.553a, Michel 1007.29 (Teos, ii B.C.):—Pass., Phld.Rh.1.125S., etc.: c.acc. rei, Th.2.64; in bad sense,
to be jealous of, envy, zhloi= de/ te gei/tona gei/twn Hes.Op.23, cf. h.Cer.168, 223, Theoc.6.27; th\n au(tou= gunai=ka LXXSi.9.1: abs.,
to be jealous, 1 Ep.Cor.13.4; zhlw/santes
through jealousy, Act.Ap.7.9. c. acc. pers.,
to be jealous for, LXXNu.11.29.
esteem or
pronounce happy, admire, praise, tina/ tinos one for a thing, S.El.1027, Isoc.4.91; zhlw= se th=s eu)bouli/as Ar.Ach.1008 (lyr.); th=s eu)glwtti/as Id.Eq.837; th=s eu)tuxi/as to\n pre/sbun Id.V.1450 (lyr.); tou= plou/tou X.Smp.4.45; tina\ e)pi/ tisi IG 12(5).860.47 (Tenos, i B.C.): more rarely, z. tina/ ti S.Aj.552; z. se o(qou/neka . . A.Pr.332; th\n po/lin, o(/ti . . X.HG6.5.45; polla/ se zhlw= bi/ou, ma/lista d' ei) . . S.Fr.584: c. part., se z. qano/nta pri\n kakw=n i)dei=n ba/qos A.Pers.712 (troch.), cf.E.Or.521: iron., zhlw=<*>se happy in your ignorance! Id.Med.60; u(mw=n ou) zhlou=men to\ a)/fron Th.5.105:—Pass.,
to be deemed fortunate, u(po/ tinwn Pl.Phdr.232a. c. acc.rei,
desire emulously, strive after, affect, o( me\n do/chs e)piqumei= kai\ tou=t' e)zh/lwke D.2.15; a)reth/n Id.20.141; a)strologi/an Epicur.Ep.2p.53U.; ma/qhsin PSI1.94.9 (ii A.D.); pi/stin Cod.Just.1.1.3.2:—Pass., h( a)reth\ u(po\ pa/ntwn tw=n a)nqrw/pwn zhlou=tai Lys.2.26; ta\ zhlou/mena Arist.Rh. 1360b34. also of persons,
pay zealous court to, Ep.Gal.4.17:—Pass., ib.18.

zh/l-wma, atos, to/,
that which is emulated: object of envy or
ambition, Phld.Rh.2.27S.: in pl.,
high fortune, E.IT379; z. turannika/ D.H.7.55. in pl. also,
emulous efforts, rivalries, ne/wn z. Aeschin.1.191, AP7.219 (Pomp. Jun.), cf. D.19.260.
emulation, zh/lwma th=s tw=n *(rwmai/wn a)reth=s App.BC5.113: pl., Lyc. 355, Max.Tyr.7.7.

zh/l-wsis, ews, h(,
emulation, imitation, tw=n barba/rwn Th.1.132; mega/lwn suggrafe/wn mi/mhsis kai\ z. Longin.13.2, cf. Max.Tyr.7.9.
zealous pursuit, ai( polu/tropoi tou= bi/ou z. Ph. 1.362;
custom, fashion, a)rxaio/tropoi z. ib.468.
jealousy, LXXNu.5.14.

zhl-wte/os, a, on,
to be emulated, D.L.5.74. zhlwte/on
one must emulate or
copy, Plb.4.27.8, Plu.2.12a; ne/ois z. tou\s ge/rontas Id.
Fr.inc.2.
one must strive after, prao/thti Ath. Med. ap. Orib.inc.21.18.

zhl-wth/s, ou=, o(,
emulator, zealous admirer or
follower, mimhth\s kai\ z. th=s pat rw/|as a)reth=s Isoc.1.11; z. kai\ e)rastai\ th=s *lakedaimoni/wn paidei/as Pl.Prt.343a; th=s h(liki/as tou= meiraki/ou Aeschin.2.166; tw=n kalw=n bouleuma/twn ib.171; th=s au)th=s ai(re/sews SIG675.27 (Oropus, ii B.C.); maqh/sews Phld.Rh.2.262S.; pneuma/twn 1 Ep.Cor.14.12; tw=n a)gaqw=n tw=n ei)s th\n po/lin marturoume/nwn IG7.2712.99 (Acraephiae): c. gen. pers., tou= *dio/s Muson.Fr.8p.37H.; tw= pra/tw qew= Sthenid. ap. Stob.4.7.63 (nom.sg. zhlwta/s codd.); *qoukudi/dou, *)antisqe/nous, Luc.Hist.Conscr.15, Herm.14; perh.
champion, Epicur.Nat.70G.
jealous, qeo\s z. LXXEx.20.5.
zealot, used to translate *kanani/ths or *kananai=os, Ev.Luc.6.15, Act.Ap.1.13, J.BJ4.3.9; tw=n patri/wn e)qw=n Id.AJ12.6.2; tw=n no/mwn LXX 2 Ma. 4.2.

zhl-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
emulous, Arist.Rh.1388a36, Ptol.Tetr.167; peri/ ti Arist.Rh.1388b9; lo/gos Ph.1.135.

zhl-wto/s, h/, o/n, also o/s, o/n E.Andr.5, Med.1035; Dor. za_l- Simon., Pi.(v. infr.):—
enviable, of things, sofi/a Pl.Hp.Mi.368b; kala\ kai\ z. e)pigra/mmata D.22.72: Comp., Isoc.6.95; zhlwto\n o( plou=tos Lycurg.Fr.97.
to be deemed happy, to beenvied, of persons, Thgn.455, S.Ant.1161; tini by one, A. Pers.710 (troch.), E.Med.1035, Pl.Smp.197d, etc.; u(po/ tinos Isoc.5.69: c.gen. rei, qh=ke/ min zalwto\n o(mo/fronos eu)na=s Pi.O.7.6; z. th=s eu)noi/as Plu.Pomp.61: c. dat., Id.Luc.38. of conditions,
enviable, blessed, ai)w/n Simon.71, E.Med.243; po/tmos Arist.Fr.675; zhlwto/tatos bi/os Ar.Nu.464 (lyr.); ga/mos Plu.2.289b, etc.

zhmi/a, Dor. za_mi/a (SIG239Diii5 (Delph., iv B.C.), etc., later sami/a Delph.3(1).342 (ii B.C.), cf. tami/a, a)tta/mios), h(,
loss, damage, Epich. 148; opp. ke/rdos, Lys.7.12, Pl.Lg.835b, Arist.EN1132b12; zhmi/an or -i/as labei=n to sustain
loss, S.Fr.807, D.11.11; z. poiei=n Ar.Pl.1124; z. e)rga/zesqai Is.6.20 (unless in signf. 1.2); z. fe/reinth=| po/lei Pl.Lg.l.c.; z. ei)=nai nomi/zein consider
as loss, Isoc.3.50, Is.7.23; z. plei/ona u(pome/nein th=s timh=s PFlor.142.8 (iii A.D.). z. e)rga/zesqai, of a slave, be guilty of a
delict, Is.6.20 (v. supr.), Hyp.Ath.22.
penalty in money,
fine, zhmi/hn a)poti/nein Hdt.2.65, cf. PHal.1.195 (iii B.C.); e)kti/nein Pl. Lg.774e; i(rh\n z. o)fei/lein Hdt.3.52; z. kataba/llein D.24.83, cf. SIG l.c.; meta\ . . xrhma/twn zhmi/as Pl.Lg.862d; z. e)pe/keito stath/r Th.3.70; zhmi/an o)fei/lein ta/lanton Plu.Lys.27; th=s z. a)feqh=nai Id.Arist.4. generally,
penalty, z. e)pitiqe/nai tini/ Hdt.1.144; z. e)/pesti/ tini Id.2.136; pro/skeitai/ tini X.Vect.4.21; glw/ssh| z. prostri/betai A.Pr. 331, cf. 384; with the penalty added, qa/naton z. e)piqe/sqai, proqei=nai, ta/cai, to make death
the penalty, Th.2.24, 3.44, D.20.135; qa/natos h( z. e)pi/keitai Hdt.2.38, cf. 65; but e)f' oi(=s . . qa/natos h( z. Pl.Prt.325b: in pl., qana/tou zhmi/ai pro/keintai Th.3.45 (v.l.): c. gen. criminis, z. a)diki/as
penalty for . . , Pl.Tht.176d, cf. Lg.860e (pl.). simply,
expense, SIG717.81 (ii/i B.C.), PLond.5.1660.10, 1674.23 (pl., vi A.D.). of what is bought too dearly, a
bad bargain, a
dead loss, X.Mem.2.3.2: usu. with Adj., fanera\ za_mi/a Ar.Ach.737; kaqara\ z., lampra\ z., Alciphr.3.21,38, cf. Alex.56.6.

zhmia/zw,
damno, Gloss.

zhmio-prakte/w,
exact punishment from, tina\ ta\ mh\ kaqh/konta PTaur.7.7 (ii B.C.).

zhmio/-yu_xos,
damnatissimus, Gloss.

zhmi-o/w, fut. -w/sw Lys.1.48: aor. 1 e)zhmi/wsa E.Or.578, Th.2.65, etc.: pf. e)zhmi/wka D.21.49:—Pass., fut. zhmiwqh/somai Lys.29.4, Is.10.16, X.Mem.3.9.12; more freq. Med. zhmiw/somai in pass. sense, Hdt. 7.39, And.1.72, Th.3.40, Isoc.18.37, D.1.27, Arist.Pol.1320a10: aor. e)zhmiw/qhn Pl.Lg.855b, Isoc.15.160: pf. e)zhmi/wmai Din.3.16, Arist.Rh. 1372b8:—
cause loss or
do damage to, penalize, po/lin Lys.30.25; tosau/tas h(me/ras zhmiou=n tina
to cause one
the loss of . . , Ael.VH3.23: c. Adj. neut., mhde\n mhde/na Pl.Lg.846a; ou)de\n z. to\ koino/n Isoc.6.5; plei/w z. sauto\n h)/ . . X.Cyr.3.1.30:—Pass., mega/la zhmiw/setai
will suffer great
losses, Th.3.40; polla/ Pl.Lg.916e: abs., Id.Grg. 490c.
fine, mulct in a sum of money, c. dat. rei, z. tina\ xili/h|si draxmh=|si Hdt.6.21, cf. 136; xrh/masin Th.2.65; mnai=s trisi/ Pl.Lg. 936a; also z. tina\ e(/ws tria/konta mna=s Lycurg.Fr.40 (dub. l.); tina/ tinos
deprive of . . , Lyd.Mag.2.19:—Pass.,
to be fined or
amerced in a thing, c. dat. rei, xrh/masi Antipho 2.4.7; draxmh=| th=s h(me/ras Pl.Lg.
766d; me/xri tosou/tou ib.855b: also, c.acc.rei, tau=ta ib.774b; z. tria/konta li/tras Arist.Fr.476;
suffer financial loss, PFlor. 142.8 (iii A.D.): hence metaph., tou= e(no\s tou= perie/xeai ma/lista th=| yuxh=| zhmiw/s eai
wilt lose, Hdt.7.39; th\n yuxh\n au)tou= Ev.Matt.16.26; e(auto/n Ev.Luc. 9.25; ta\ ke/rata Ael.NA10.1. generally,
punish, th\n qa/lassan Hdt.7.35; sfe/as Id.9.77; tina\ qana/tw| Id.3.27; tina\ fugh=|, plhgai=s, Th.4.65, 8.74:—Pass., zhmiou=sqai zhmi/ais e)sxa/tais Lys.31.26; qana/tw| Antipho 3.3.9, PTeb.5.92 (ii B.C.); qana/tw| kai\ pa=si toi=s e)sxa/tois Pl.Plt.297e; xrh/masin kai\ a)timi/a Id.Lg.721b.

zhmi-w/dhs, es,
causing loss, ruinous, Id.Cra.417d, Lg.650a, X.Mem.3.4.11. Adv. -dw=s, censured by Poll.8.147.

zhmi/-wma, atos, to/, (zhmio/w)
penalty, fine, Luc.Prom.13, Sammelb.5174.13 (vi A.D.), etc.; th=s a)taci/as for their disorder, X.HG3.1.9; -w/mata e)/stw a)stuno/mois let them have
the right of imposing penalties, Pl.Lg.764c.
loss, opp. lh=mma, BGU419.13 (iii A.D.);
injury, damage, z. prostri/besqai/ tini D.C.52.33.

zhmi/-wsis, ews, h(,
infliction of penalties, Arist.Pol.1300b22 (pl.).

zhmi-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
likely to suffer loss, Vett.Val.67.19, al.

*zh/n, v. *zeu/s. *zh/nion u(/dwr (cf.foreg.),
rain-water, PMag.Par.1.225.

*zhnodo/teios, a, on,
of the School of Zenodotus, D.L.2.15.

*zhnodoth/r, h=ros, o(,
giver of Zeus, i.e. of his counsel, AP9.525.7.

*zhnoposeidw=n, o(,
Zeus-Poseidon, a divinity worshipped in Caria, Machoap.Ath.8.337c, cf. 2.42a, CIG2700add.(Mylasa); Dor. *za_nopoteida/n GDI5163b12 (ibid.).

zh=nos, h, on, perh. = ze/i+nos,
made of spelt（ze/a), UPZ94.1, al. (ii B.C.).

*zhno/frwn, on, gen. onos, (*zh/n, frh/n)
knowing the mind of Zeus, epith. of Apollo as revealing Zeus' will in oracles, AP9.525.7.

*zhnw/neios, on,
of Zeno, ai(/resis D.L.1.19; to\ Z. Ph.2.460; Z., o(,
Stoic philosopher, D.L.7.5:—also *zhnwniko/s, Dor. *za_n-, h/, o/n, e)/rws Cerc.9.16.

zh=sis, ews, h(,
vitalization, Dam.Pr.83bis.

zh=ta, to/, indecl.,
the letter z, Pl.Cra.419b, etc.; of the
sixth book of the Iliad, POxy.930.15 (ii/iii A.D.), Epigr.Gr.1095. (Semitic
zayin, influenced by the names of the following letters, Gr.h)=ta, qh=ta.)

zhta^rethsia/dhs, ou, o(,
virtue-seeker, Epigr. ap. Hegesand.2.
zht-eu/w, poet. for sq., Hes.Op.400, h.Ap.215, h.Merc.392: Dor. za_teu/w Alcm.33.8.

zht-e/w, Dor. part. za/teisa Theoc.1.85: impf. e)zh/toun, Ep. 3sg. zh/tei Il.14.258 (nowh. else in Hom.): aor. 1 e)zh/thsa Isoc.16.14: pf. e)zh/thka Din.2.19:—Med., aor. 1 e)zhthsa/mhn （a)n-) Longus Prooem.2:—Pass., fut. zhthqh/somai S.E.P.1.60, M.8.16; but zhth/somai in pass. sense, ib.1.28, Gal.1.649:—
seek, seek for, e)me\ d' e)/coxa pa/ntwn zh/tei Il.l.c.; z. phma/twn a)pallaga/s A.Pr.318, cf. 264; eu(rh/seis zhtw=n Ar.Pl.105; mh\ zhtw=n without
seeking, X.Ages. 8.1; to\ zhtou/menon a(lwto/n
what is sought for may be found, S.OT 110.
mquire for, ta\ pina/kia kai\ ta\ grammat ei=a IG12.91.11; tou\s a)/rxontas X.An.2.3.2: with relat. clause, o(/tou de/oito o( *ku=ros Id.Cyr. 8.5.13.
search after, search out, to\n au)to/xeira S.OT266; mega/lois mhnu/trois e)zhtou=nto oi( dra/santes Th.6.27; of huntsmen, z. to\n lagw/ X.Cyn.6.25.
search or
inquire into, investigate, examine, of philosophical investigation, z. ta\ qei=a X.Mem.1.1.15; z. kai\ e)reunw= kata\ to\n qeo/n Pl.Ap.23b; zhtoume/nhs a)reth=s o(/ ti e)sti/n Id.Men.79d; to\ zhtou/menon the
matter of inquiry, the
question, Id.Tht.201a, Arist. Top.110a7, Str.2.1.18, A.D.Adv.188.13; also of judicial
inquiry, z. peri\ a)dikhma/twn Din.1.8; zh/thsin th\n u(pe/r tinos z. ib.10; e)/noxos ei)=nai toi=s zhtoume/nois ib.55: generally, z. po/teron . . h)/ Pl.Phlb.27c; z. pro\s e)mauto/n Luc.Lex.17.
require, demand, tw=n pra/cewn para\ tou= strathgou= to\n lo/gon zhtou=ntes D.4.33: metaph., o( perikra/nios u(mh\n . . th\n e)pidiai/resin z.
requires the opening up of the wound, Heliod. ap. Orib.46.7.3.
seek after, desire, a)mh/xana E.Alc.203; e)moi\ zhtw=n o)/leqron S.OT659; of natural tendencies, o( qermo\s u(/fammon xw/ran zhtei= Thphr.HP8.11.8:—Pass., zhtou/menos
sought after, in great demand, PMag.Par.1.3086,3114. c. inf.,
seek to do, e)kmaqei=n ti z. Hdt.3.137, A.Pr.776; metalabei=n Ar.Pl.370. cf. Pl.Prt. 322b, Men.90e, SIG372.7 (Samothrace, iii B.C.): c. fut. inf., zhtei=s a)napei/sein Ar.Pl.573 codd. (sed leg. -pei/qein): c. acc. et inf.,
seek or
desire that, Pl.R.443b, Chrm.172c.
have to seek, feel the want of, i(/na mh\ zhte/oien siti/a Hdt.1.94; *ne/rwna Plu.Galb.8:—Pass., zhtou/menos oi(=s a)pe/leipes Epigr.Gr.215.3 (Rhenea).

zh/t-hma, atos, to/,
that which is sought, Hp.VM3; ou) r(a/dion z.
a thing not easy
to find, of Pentheus' mutilated limbs, E.Ba.1139; dusnoou/menon z., of God, Secund.Sent.3.
inquiry, question, S.OT278, Act.Ap.15.2,al.; esp. of a philosophic nature, to\ peri\ no/mous z. Pl.Lg.631a; ta\ peri\ fu/sews z. ib.891c; poihtikw=n z. lu/seis Metrod.Herc.831.13; also tou=t' . . ou(= tugxa/nei z. Pl.Cra.421a; e)kei=no/ g' h)=n to\ z. prw=ton, po/teron . . Id.Sph.221c;
search, sw=ma muri/ois zhth/masin eu(rw/n E.Ba.1218; mhtro/s
after her, Id.Ion1352.
official or
judicial inquiry, POxy.97.14 (ii A.D.). in pl.,
claims, PRyl.117.14 (iii A.D.);
subjects of dispute, SIG785.8 (i A.D.), Act.Ap.25.19.
zht-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg. 11, Arr.Epict. 2.16.20, Lib.Decl.46Pr.2.
zht-hmatiko/s, h/, o/n, = zhthtiko/s 2, Sch.Pl.p.212H.
*zhth/r, epith. of Zeus in Cyprus, Hsch.

zht-hsimos, on,
to be searched, ta\ z.
places to be beaten for game, X. Cyn.6.6.

zh/t-hsis, ews, h(,
seeking, search for, kat' *eu)rw/phs zh/thsin e)kplw=sai Hdt.2.44; kata\ bi/ou te kai\ gh=s z. Id.1.94, cf. 2.54; a)ndro\s kata\ zh/thsin in
quest of him, S.Tr.55; h( z. tw=n drasa/ntwn Th.8.66; z. e)pisth/mhs Pl.Tht.196d, etc.; th=s trofh=s Th.8.57; th=s a)lhqei/as Id.1.20.
searching, examining, zh/thsin e)poie/eto tw=n new=n
searched the ships, Hdt.6.118, cf. Lys.12.30, Aeschin.1.43.
inquiry, investigation, esp. of a philosophic nature, Pl.Cra.406a, Ap.29c, al.; peri\ th=s tou= panto\s fu/sews Id.Ti.47a; z. tou= me/llontos dia\ o)rni/qwn poiei=sqai
inquire into the future by augury, Id.Phdr.244c: in pl., Id.Phd.66d, Phld.Rh.1.276S., 2.185S.
judicial inquiry, Din.1.10, POxy.237 vi7 (ii A.D.), etc.: pl.,
suits, controversies, OGI629.9 (Palmyra, ii A.D.).

zht-hte/os, a, on,
to be sought, S.Aj.470, Ar.Th. 604, etc. zhthte/on,
one must seek, Id.Nu.761, Sannyr.8; h)/ tina e(te/ran [du/namin] . . h(mi=n z. Pl.Phlb.58d.
zht-hth/rion, to/, = basanisth/rion, Anon. ap. Suid.

zht-hth/s, ou=, o(,
seeker, inquirer, tinos Pl.R. 618c; fau=los z. Id.Chrm.175e. zhthtai/, oi(, at Athens,
commissioners to inquire into extraordinary offences to
to recover moneys owing to the State, And.1.14 (sg.), Lys.21.16, D.24.11, Pl.Com.125 (sg.).

zht-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
disposed to search or
inquire, Pl.Men.81e, Ptol.Tetr.6; tinos
into a thing, Pl.Ax.366b; peri/ ti Id.R.528c. oi( z. dia/logoi Plato's dialogues
of search or
investigation, opp. oi( u(fhghtikoi/, Thrasyll. ap. D.L.3.49; to\ z. e)/xousi pa/ntes oi( tou= *swkra/tous lo/goi are
devoted to search or
inquiry, Arist.Pol.1265a12. Adv. -kw=s Procl.in Prm.p.515S. oi( zhthtikoi/, a name given to
the Sceptics, D.L.9.69; h( zhthtikh/
their philosophy, ib.70; h( z. a)gwgh/ S.E. P.1.7.

zht-hto/s, h/, o/n,
sought for, tini S.OC389.
zhto/s, Arc. zato/s, = zhthto/s, IG5(2).4.22 (Tegea, iv B.C.).

zh/tr-eion or zhtr-ei=on, to/,
a place of punishment for slaves at Chios, Eup.19D., Theopomp.Com.63, cf. EM411.33, Eust.837.44:

zh/tr-ion, prob. in Herod.5.32, cf. Choerob. ap. EM l.c.: metaph. in dat. pl. -i/ois, 'treadmills', dub. in Phld.Oec.p.44J.:—the forms zw/steion, Ar.Fr.93; zw/nteion or zhtr-ei=on, Poll.3.78, Zonar.; zw/teion, EM414.40 are incorrect.
zhtr-eu/w, in Dor. form zatr-, = e)n mulw=ni basani/zw, EM408.12.

zhtr-o/s, o(,
executioner, Hsch.
zh/twr, oros, o(, = zhthth/s, Hsch., Phot.
zibu/nh, h(, = sibu/nh, LXXIs.2.4, Ph.Bel.92.44, Porph. ap. Eus.PE 3.12: zhbh/nh, Hsch.:—Dim. zibu/nnion, to/, Id.

ziggi/beris, ews, Edict.Diocl.32.68 (
Delph., Clit.), o(, h( (both in Edict.Diocl. l.c.); or ziggi/beri, to/, Dsc. (codd. opt.) and Gal. Il. cc.:—an Arabian spice-plant, the root of which was used in medicine, prob.
ginger, Dsc.2.160, Gal.6.572, 11.880. (Perh. fr. Malay
inchi-ver (
inchi = root) through Skt.
śṛ[ndot ]gaveram and a Prakrit
singaber.）

zi/ggos, o(,
humming of bees, etc., Hsch.

ziggo/w,
drink (Cilician word), Nicostr.Com.38.
zi/glas: kw=la, Hsch.

zigni/s, i/dos, h(, a kind of
lizard, Arist.HA604b24 (v.Il. deimnu/s, zignu/s, dignu/s, zi/gnhs).
zignw=sai: skuqrwpa/sai, EM411.52, Hsch. (zikn- cod.).

ziza/nion, to/, a weed that grows in wheat, = ai)=ra 11, prob.
darnel, Lolium temulentum, Gp.2.43, EM411.46: pl., Ev.Matt.13.25, Gp. 10.87.1. (Cf. Sumer.
zizân 'wheat'.)

zizoula/, to/,
jujube, Alex.Trall.6.5; cf. sq. and Ital.
giuggiola, zizzola.

zi/zu^fon, to/, a tree, the fruit of which is
the jujube, Zizyphus vulgaris, Gp.10.3.4;
ziziphus, Colum.9.4.3: gen. pl.
zizuforum, Edict. Diocl.6.56.
zi/kaios, Elean for di/kaios, Schwyzer 409 (vi B.C.):—also perh. written zike/a, epith. of Nemesis, BMus.Inscr.1079 (Egypt (?)).

zi/lai, v. zela=s. zini/xion, to/,
shoe-latchet, Suid. zita=na: katapu/gona, Hsch. zi/fuios, Elean for di/f-. zi/w, = zhte/w, EM411.51: zi/etai: zhtei=tai, ibid., Hsch. zmara/gdinos, v. smar-. zma/w, v. sma/w. zmh=ma, v. smh=ma. zmirriei=a, ta/,
emery, IG12(8).51.20 (Imbros, ii B.C.); cf. smu/ris. zmu/rnh, zmu/rninos, etc., v. smu/rn-. zo/a, zo/h, zota, v. zwh/. zo/ason: sbe/son, Hsch. zoo/s, v. zwo/s. zorka/s, a/dos, and zo/rc, zorko/s, h(, v. dorka/s. zou/gwner, Lacon. for zu/gwnes,
ploughing oxen, Id. zou/i+on h)\
zou=on: qhri/on, h)\ e)rusi/pelas, Id. (Prob. Thess. for zw=|on.) zou/sqw: zwnnu/sqw, Id. (Prob. Thess.)
zo/f-eos, a, on, v.l. for sq., nu/c Nic.Al.501.

zof-ero/s, a/, o/n, (zo/fos)
dusky, gloomy, *xa/os Hes.Th.814; oi)/khma Hp.
Acut.(Sp.) 18, cf. Hierocl.p.33A.; opp. lampro/s, of the air,
misty, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.140, cf. Luc.Nigr.4; th\n qa/lassan zofera\n diafai/nesqai Arist.Mir. 843a25; to\ zofero/n Hp.Virg.1, Arist.de An.426b2. metaph., z. fronti/des AP5.296.8 (Agath.).
zo/f-ios, on,= zo/feos, zofero/s, ib. 7.377 (Eryc.).

zofo-dorpi/das, a, o(,
supping in the dark or
in secret, of Pittacus, Alc. 37 B, cf. Plu.2.726a:
zofo-dorpi/as in Theognost.Can.20, Zonar.; zofo-derki/as, Hsch., Suid.

zofo-ei/delos, on,
dusky, gloomy, Nic.Th. 657.

zofo-eidh/s, e/s,
dark-coloured, Hp.Mul.1.11; of the colour of an elephant, Aret.SD2.13.
zofo/-eis, essa, en, = foreg., Nic.Th.775, Al. 474, Orph.H.78.4.
zofo-mhni/a, h(, （mh/nh） = skotomhni/a, Hsch., Gramm. in Reitzenstein Ind.Lect.Rost.1892/3p.10.
zofo/-pnoia, h(, = h( a)po\ du/sews pnoh/, Sch.Il.21.334.

zo/fos, o(,
nether darkness, i(eme/nwn *)/erebo/sde u(po\ zo/fon Od.20.356, cf. 11.155, Il.21.56, Ep.Jud.6; *)ai/+dhs d' e)/laxe zo/fon h)ero/enta obtained
the realms of gloom for his share, Il.15.191, cf.Od.11.57, h.Cer. 402, 446, etc.; gh=s u(po\ zo/fon A.Pers.839. generally,
gloom, darkness, Hes.Sc.227, Plb.18.20.7, Arist.Mu.400a8, Ep.Hebr.12.18, Plu.Alc.28, Luc.DMort.15.2; xeime/rios z.
the gloom of winter, Pi.I. 4(3).18: metaph., th=s yuxh=s . . z. Plu.2.48c.
the dark quarter, i.e.
the West, h)/dh ga\r fa/os oi)/xeq' u(po\ zo/fon Od.3.335; ou) ga\r i)/dmen o(/ph| z. ou)d' o(/ph| h)w/s 10.190; poti\ zo/fon, opp. pro\s h)w= t' h)e/lio/n te, Il.12.240, Od.13.241, 9.26 (
the North acc. to Str.10.2.12); *gadei/rwn to\ pro\s zo/fon to
the west of . . , Pi.N.4.69.—Poet. and later Prose. (Prob. cogn. with ze/furos.)

zof-o/w,
darken, Hld.2.15:—Pass.,
to be or
become dark, gh/ra| kanqo\n e)zofwme/nos AP6.92 (Phil.); th\n o)/yin e)zofwme/nos Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.
4.

zof-w/dhs, es,= zofoeidh/s, ou)=ron Hp.Coac.570; qa/latta Arist.Pr. 944b22; a)h/r ib.946a34 (Sup.), cf. Vett. Val.312.32; [selh/nh] Thphr. Sign.12; *bo/sporos Str.1.2.9; *eu)=ros App.Hann.20;
opaque, Cleom. 1.4.

zo/f-wsis, ews, h(,
a darkening, a)e/ros Sch.E.Ph.1534.
zo/w, v. zw=.

zu^ga/dhn [a^], Adv., (zugo/n)
jointly, in pairs, Ph.1.237, al., Phot., Suid.

zu^ga/dion, to/, a kind of
shoe, prob. in Suid. s.v. curi/des.

zu/gaina [u^], hs, h(,
the hammer-headed shark, Epich.59, Arist.HA 506b10, Philotim. ap. Gal.6.727, Ael.NA9.49, Opp.H.1.367.

zu^ga/rx-hs, ou, o(,
leader of a line of horsemen, Ascl.Tact.7.9, Ael. Tact.19.8:—hence zu^garx-e/w, Ascl. l.c.

zu^garx-i/a, h(,
detachment of two chariots, ib.8, Ael.Tact.22.2.
zu^ga/strion, to/, Dim. of sq., Poll.7.79, 10.138.

zu/gastron [u^], to/,
chest, box (kibwto/s, kuri/ws de\ culi/nh soro/s, para\ to\ e)zugw=sqai, Phot.), S.Tr.692, E.ap.Phot., X.Cyr.7.3.1. at Delphi, = grammatofula/kion, SIG241.49,146 (iv B.C.), Delph.3(2).205 (iii B.C.), Phot. in pl.,
fastenings, la/rnakos Sch.Theoc. 7.78.
zugastrofe/w, doubtful word in Sophr.90.

zu^g-e/w,
march in line, opp. stoixei=n (in file), Ascl.Tact.2.6,al.
form a line, of contingents, Plb.3.113.8.

zu^g-hdo/n, Adv.
in pairs, Hld.10.27.
zu^ghfo/ros, on, poet. for zugofo/ros (q.v.), A.Fr.326, E.Rh.303.

zu^gi/a, h(,
maple, Acer campestre, Thphr.HP3.3.1, 5.3.3, Dicaearch. 2.2, Plin.HN16.67.

zu^g-iath/s,
jumentarius, Gloss.
zu^g-i/zw, = zeug-, Suid.

zu^g-iko/s, h/, o/n, (zugo/s)
of or
for a balance, ta\ -ka/ Nicom.Harm.2.
zu^/g-imos, on, = zu/gios 1, bou=s Plb.34.8.9.

zu^/g-inos, h, on,
of the tree zugi/a, Thphr. HP5.3.3.
zu^/g-ion, to/, = zugo/n 111.1, u(po\ ta\ z. Callix. 1, cf. Aq., Sm. Pr.11.1.

zu^/g-ios, a, on, also os, on E. (v. infr.), IG22.1604.71 (iv B.C.): (zu^go/n):—
of or
for the yoke, esp. (sc. i(/ppos)
draught-horse, opp. seirafo/ros, E.IA221 (lyr.), Ar.Nu.122: c. gen., qhrw=n zugi/ous zeu/casa sati/nas having yoked cars to
teams of beasts, E.Hel.1310: as Subst., kataskeua/sai . . o(do\n zugi/ois poreuth/n Milet.3 No.149.45 (ii B.C.). epith. of Hera as patroness of marriage, A.R.4.96, Musae.275; also of other divinities, as Aphrodite, IG3.171, cf.AP 7.555 (Joann.), Hsch. zu/gios, o(, = zugi/ths, Poll.1.87,120; kw/ph z. IG22.l.c., Polyaen.5.22.4 (pl.).
of full weight, nomi/smata Stud.Pal.20.121.18 (v A.D.).
zu^g-i/s, i/dos, h(, = e(/rpullos, Dsc. 3.38, Philin. ap. Ath.15.681f.
zu^g-i/skon, to/, Dim. of zu/gion, IG22 1549.9.

zu^g-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
the rower who sat on the mid-most of the three banks, like meso/neos, Sch.Ar.Ra.1106.
zu^gi=tis, idos, fem. of zu/gios 11, Nicom. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.144B.
zugklei=: mu/ei, o(rma=|, skuqrwpa/zei, Hsch.
zu^go-de/smion, to/, Dim. of sq., PLond.1821.113.

zu^go/-desmon, to/, (zugo/n 1)
yoke-band, i.e. a band for fastening the yoke to the pole, z. a(/ma zugw=| e)nnea/phxu Il.24.270, cf. PFay.121.5 (i/ii A.D.); of the Gordian knot, Plu.Alex.18, etc.: pl., zugo/desma Procl.H.1.31, AP 9.155 (Agath.), 741, etc.:—also zu^go/-desmos, o(, Artem.2.24, Them.Or. 2.30b.
zu^go-de/ths, ou, o(, (de/w A) = foreg., Hsch.

zu^go-eidh/s, e/s,
like a yoke, o)sta= Gal.14.721.
zu^go/-eis: bou/turos, Cyr. (zugoh/seis: bo/trus Hsch.).

zu^go-ke/fa^lon, to/,
tax on land at so much a jugum, CIG2712.5 (Mylasa, v A.D.), Just.Nov.17.8.

zu^go-krou/sths, ou, o(,
one who uses a false balance, Artem.4.57.
zu^go/-lwron, to/, = zugo/desmos, Sch.rec.A. Pers.188.

zu^go-ma^xe/w,
struggle with one's yoke-fellow, i(/ppou e)n a(/rmati z. App.Syr.33. generally,
struggle, quarrel, tini Com.Adesp. 207, cf. Hyp.Fr.245, Procop.Gaz.p.141 B.; pornoboskoi=s . . dia\ bi/ou z. Phld.Herc.223.8; peri/ tinos D.39.6; pro\s th\n tu/xhn Men.673; pro\s oi)ke/thn Plu.Cat.Ma.21, cf. Chor. in Hermes 17.235; u(pe\r o)no/matos Gal. 10.963.

zu^go-ma^xi/a, h(,
quarrelling, strife, Aristaenet.1.2.

zu^go/n, to/, also zugo/s, o(, (in various senses), h.Cer.217, Pl.Ti.63b, Theoc.30.29, LXXGe.27.40, al., Plb.4.82.2, Ev.Matt.11.29, Jul.Or.5.173a, etc.: rarely in pl., zugoi/ LXXPr.11.1, Sch.Th.1.29: Delph. dugo/s (q.v.).
yoke of a plough or carriage, z. i(/ppeion Il.5.799, 23.392; u(po\ zugo\n h)/gagen i(/ppous 5.731, cf. Od.3.383; e)pi\ zugo\n au)xe/ni qei=nai bousi/ Hes.Op.815, cf. 581; u(po\ zugo/fin (i.e. zugou=） lu/on i(/ppous Il.24.576: prov., to\n au)to\n e(/lkein z. 'to be in the same boat', Aristaenet.2.7, Zen.3.43; tau)/t' e)moi\ z. tri/beis Herod.6.12. metaph., e)pi\ zugo\s au)xe/ni kei=tai h.Cer.217; e)xqroi=sin u(po\ zugo\n au)xe/na qh/sw Thgn.1023; e)pauxe/nion labei=n z. Pi.P.2.93; dou/lion z.
the yoke of slavery, Hdt.7.8.g/, A.Th.75 (pl.), 471, etc.; doulei/as, a)na/gkhs z., S.Aj.944, E.Or.1330; u(po\ zugw=| lo/fon dikai/ws ei)=xon S.Ant.291; e)pitiqe/nai tini\ zuga\ tou= mh\ . . so as to prevent . . , X.Cyr.3.1.27; zugw=| zugh=nai Pl.R.508a; a)/gein u(po\ to\n z. tina/s Plb.4.82.2, cf. D.H.3.22; u(po\ to\n z. u(pagagei=n D.C.Fr.36.10; zugo\n u(posth=nai D.H.10.20.
crossbar of the fo/rmigc, Il.9.187. zugo\s h( th=s a)mpe/lou pro\s th\n xa/raka suzugi/a Gp.5.29.6. in pl.,
thwarts or
benches joining the opposite sides of a ship, Od.9.99, 13.21, Hdt.2.96: rarely in sg., qoo\n ei)resi/as zugo/n S.Aj.249 (lyr.): metaph., of the seat of authority compared to the helmsman's seat, e)s to\ prw=ton po/leos z. E.Ion595; e)pei\ d' e)pi\ zugoi=s kaqe/zet' a)rxh=s Id.Ph.74; su\ tau=ta fwnei=s nerte/ra| prosh/menos kw/ph|, kratou/ntwn tw=n e)pi\ zugw=| doro/s; while on the
main thwart sits authority, A.Ag.1618; also of a coachman's
seat, box, PMasp.303.15 (vi A.D.). in pl.,
panels of a door, IG12.372.199,22.1457.14,1672.155; cf. zeugi/on.
beam of the balance, zugo\n tala/ntou A.Supp.822 (lyr.), cf. Arist.Mech.850a4: hence,
the balance itself (cf. ph=xus IV), ai)/rein to\n zugo/n Pl.Ti.63b; e)n pla/stiggi zugou= kei=sqai Id.R.55oe; zugw=| or e)n tw=| z. i(sta/nai, Lys.10.18, Pl. Prt.356b; zugo\n i(sta/nai D.Prooem.55: in pl., Id.25.46, SIG975.39 (Delos, iii B.C.): prov., z. mh\ u(perbai/nein Pythag. ap. D.L.8.18. the constellation Libra, Hipparch.3.1.5, Ph.1.28, Man.2.137, etc.; z. *)afrodi/ths Porph.Antr.22. karxasi/ou the
yard-arm at the mast head, Pi.N.5.51, cf. Ach.Tat.5.16.
cross-strap of a sandal, Ar.Lys.417, Poll.7.81; zugo/s, o(, Phot.
pair, kleino\n zugo/n, of persons, E.Hel.392; kata\ zuga/ in
pairs, Arist.HA544a5, Theoc.13.32.
rank or
line of soldiers, opp.
file (stoi=xos）, e)n tw=| prw/tw| z. e)ma/xonto te/ssares Th.5.68; o( zugo/s Polyaen.4.4.3 (ta\ zuga/ 2.10.4); kata\ zugo/n
line with line, Plb.1.45.9; kat' a)/ndra kai\ z. Id.3.81.2; esp.
front rank, Ael.Tact.7.1, Arr.Tact.8.1; also of the Chorus, Poll.4.108. zuga\ h)\ a)/zuga
even or odd, a game, Sch.Ar.Pl.817. measure of land, SIG963.13 (Amorgos, iv B.C.).

zu^gopoi-e/w,
make yokes, wrongly cited by Poll.7.115 fr. Ar.Pl. 513.

zu^gopoi-o/s, o(,
maker of yokes, Pherecr.130.
zu^go/s, o(, v. sub zugo/n.
zu^gostaqm-e/w, = zugostate/w, Tz.ad Lyc.270, 275 (both Pass.).

zu^go/staqm-os, o(,
balance, Plu.2.928b.

zu^gosta^s-i/a, h(,
weighing, PGrenf.2.46a8 (ii A.D.).

zu^gosta^/s-ion, to/,
weigh-house, CIG3705 (Apollonia ad Rhyndacum), JRS2.87 (Antioch in Pisidia): pl., IGRom.4.657 (Acmonia); -stasi/ou [te/los]
weighing-toll, BGU337.20 (ii/iii A.D.).
zygostasii munus, office of zugosta/ths, Cod.Just.11.28.1.

zu^gosta^t-e/w,
weigh by the balance, weigh, w(/sper e)n truta/nh| Luc. Hist.Conscr.49; tina\s pro\s to\n *tima/rxou braxi/ona Alciphr.2.2.
act as libripens, MitteisChr.316ii4 (ii A.D.). Pass.,
to be in equilibrium, Plb.6.10.7; e)zugostatei=to au)toi=s o( po/lemos Id.1.20.5.

zu^gosta^/t-hma, atos, to/,
balance, Eust.665.29.

zu^gosta^/t-hs, ou, Dor. zu^gosta^/t-a_s, o(,
public weigher, Cod.Just.10.73.2 (iv A.D.), Artem.2.37: metaph., o)rqo\s w)\n z., of Zeus, Cerc.4.33.

zu^go/-tauron, to/,
yoke, pair of oxen, PFlor.167.3, 256.3 (iii A.D.).

zu^go-tra/xhlon [a^], to/,
neck-piece of yoke, PLond.3.1177.190 (ii A.D.).

zu^go-tru_ta/nh [a^], h(,
balance, Phot. s.v. zugo/s.

zu^goulko/s, o/n,
drawing the yoke, bo/es Moschio Trag.6.26.
zu^go/fin, Ep. gen. of zugo/n, Il.24.576; u(po\ z. Poet. ap. D.Chr.32.85.

zu^gofor-e/w,
weigh, in Pass., Hsch. v. zeugofore/omai.

zu^go/for-os, on,
bearing the yoke, pw=los E.HF121 (lyr., -hfo/ros codd.); i(/ppoi Plu. 2.524a: elsewh. in poet. form zughfo/ros (q.v.).

zu^go/w, (zugo/n)
yoke, join together, [ske/lh] Sor.1.84; z. kiqa/ran
put the cross-bar to the lyre, Luc.DDeor.7.4, DMar.1.4; kano/nes e)zugwme/noi du/o Agatho 4.2, cf. LXXEz.41.26.
close, xei/lh r(afai=s Paul.Aeg.6.67 (prob.);
shut off, Hp.Cord.12 (Pass.). metaph.,
bring under the yoke, subdue, A.Fr.115.

zu/gra, h(, dialectic form for diu/gra (sc. xw/ra),
marsh-land, Eust. 295.28.
zugwgo/n, glossed h(=par, dub. l. in PLond.1821.50 (prob. zugwto/n = sukwto/n).
zu^g-w/dhs, es, f.l. for zuga/dhn (wh. is restored fr. Lyd.Mens.2.12), Ph.1.22.

zu^g-wqri/zw,
weigh, examine, Ar.Nu.745, acc. to Sch.: but acc. to Poll.10.26 from zu/gwqron (
the bar of a door),
lock up.

zu^/g-wma, atos, to/,
bolt, bar, Plb.7.16.5.
cross-rod, Apollod.Poliorc.177.8. = zugo/n 111.1, Sch.Th.1.29.
arcus zygomaticus, which connects the cranial with the facial bones, Gal.2.437, 746, Poll.2.85; cf. zugoeidh/s. = zugo/n 11, Ptol.Alm.7.5.
canal-lock, PFlor.273.20 (iii A.D.).

zu^/g-wsis, ews, h(, (cf. zugo/n IV)
a balancing, kata\ th\n zu/gwsin, of heavy oars, Callix.1.

zu^g-wto/s, h/, o/n, (zugo/w)
yoked, a(/rmata z. S.El.702.
zu/qion, to/, Dim. of zu=qos, = a)lfi/tou po/sis, Hsch. (h( e)c a). p. Gramm. in Reitzenstein Ind.Lect.Rost.1892/3p.12.)

zu_qopw/lhs, ou, o(,
beer-seller, POxy.85iv4 (iv A.D.):—fem. only in form zuto/pwlis (q. v.).

zu=qos, ou, o( (also -eos, to/, Thphr. (v. infr.), D.S. (v. infr.)), an Egyptian kind of
beer, brewed with barley, Thphr.CP6.11.2, Dsc.2.87, Str.17.1.14, D.S.1.34, etc.; cf. zu=tos.
beer of northern nations, Posidon.15J., Str.3.3.7, D.S.5.26. (The word was used in Egypt acc. to Thphr. l.c., etc.: written zuto- (q. v.) in the older Pap.: freq. accented zu/qos in codd., but zu=qos Phot., zu_- in verse, Poet. ap. D.Chr.32.82, Colum.10.116.)

zu/m-h [u_], h(,
leaven, Arist.GA755a18, LXXEx.12.15;
beer-yeast, PTeb.375.27 (ii A.D.), etc.: metaph., of
corruption, falsehood, Ev. Matt.16.6, etc. (zu_-ma_ or zu_s-ma_, cf. Skt.
yauti 'mix', Skt.
yūs, Lat.
jūs 'soup', Lett.
jaut 'stir dough',
javs 'dough'.)

zum-h/eis, essa, en,
leavened, a)/rtos Hsch.

zum-i/zw,
to be like leaven, th\n o)smh/n Dsc.2.80.

zum-i/ths a)/rtos [i_], o(,
leavened bread, Cratin.99 (prob. l.), Hp. Vict.2.42, 3.75, X.An.7.3.21, LXXLe.7.3(13), Sor.1.94, Philostr.Im. 2.26.
zum-i/wsis, ews, h(, = zu/mwsis, subject of lost work by Zos. Alch.p.216B.
zu_moeidh/s, e/s, = zumw/dhs, Sch.Orib.4p.526D.

zu_m-ourgo/s, o(,
maker of leaven, PAmh.2.128.29 (ii A.D.), PFay. 333 (ii A.D.).

zu_m-o/w, zu/mh)
leaven, mikra\ zu/mh o(/lon to\ fu/rama z. 1 Ep.Cor.5.6:—Pass.,
to be leavened, ferment, LXX Ex.12.34,39, Plu.2.659b, etc.; of digestion, ta\ me/lana -ou=tai Hp.Acut.61; [koili/h] e)zumwme/nh
in a ferment, Id.VM11.
cause to effervesce, gh=n Gal.10.964, Aët.1 Praef.:—Pass., zumoume/nh [xu/tra] Alex.124.8.

zu_m-w/dhs, es,
like leaven, Arist.GA755a23.

zu_/m-wma, atos, to/,
fermented mixture, Pl.Ti.74d; zu/mwma xqono/s, of a fungus, Nic.Al.521, cf. 525 cum Sch. ad loc.

zu_/m-wsis, ews, h(,
fermentation, Pl.Ti.66b, Plu.2.659b, Gal.16.
661; h(/patos zu/mwsis
a swelling of the liver, Hp.Epid.4.8.

zu_m-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
causing to ferment, tinos Diocl.Fr.118.

zu_m-wto/s, h/, o/n,
fermented, leavened, LXXEx.13.7, al.

zu_ta=s, a=, o(,
brewer, BGU1087ii2 (iii A.D.).

zu_thra/, h(,
tax on brewing, PCair.Zen.176.30 (iii B.C.), PTeb.40.4 (ii B.C.).

zu_to-poie/w,
brew beer, PCair.Zen.199.9(iii B.C.).

zu_to-poii/+a, h(,
brewing, Ostr.Fay.10.4 (i A.D.).

zu_to-poio/s, o(,
brewer, PPetr.3p.85 (iii B.C.), al., PTeb.5.173 (ii B.C.), etc.

zu_to-pw/lion, to/,
beer-shop, PCair.Zen.189.6 (iii B.C.), al., PRyl.127.12 (i A.D.).

zu_to/-pwlis, idos, h(,
woman who sells beer, BGU38.18 (ii/iii A.D.).

zu=tos, o(,= zu=qos, PCair.Zen.176.4(iii B.C.), al., PPetr.3p.327 (iii B.C.), UPZ149.14(iii/ii B.C.), PMag.Par.1.908, OGI200.16 (Axum, iv A.D.):—also zu=tos, eos, to/, PHib.1.113.6 (iii B.C.), Glauc. ap. POxy.1802.42.

zu_tourgei=on, to/,
brewery, PPetr.ined.iii No. 124(iii B.C.), v. indicem.

zw= (contr. fr. zw/w: za/w only in Gramm., EM410.38), zh=|s (Choerob. in Theod.2.28), zh=|, zh=te (but zh=s, zh= acc. to Anon. ap. EM410.48, Sophronius ap.Choerob.in Theod.2.416); imper. zh= S.Fr.167, E.IT 699, zh=qi (as if from zh=mi, cf. EM l.c.) Pherecr.11 D., Men.Mon. 191, AP10.43, su/-zhqi Philem. ap. Et.Gen. s.v. zh=; opt. zw/|hn; inf. zh=n: impf. e)/zwn S.El.323, Ar.Ra.1072; e)/zhn in most codd. of D.24.7 is a form suggested by e)/zhs, e)/zh; 3pl. e)/zwn Ar.V.709, Pl.Lg.679c: fut. zh/sw Ar.Pl.263, Pl.R.465d, Men.Mon.186, [Epich.]267, zh/somai Hp.Nat.Puer.30, D.25.82, Arist.Pol.1327b5: aor. 1 e)/zhsa Hp. Prog.1, AP7.470 (Mel.), Plu.2.786a, etc.: pf. e)/zhka Arist.Metaph. 1048b25, D.H.5.68, etc.: but in Att. aor. and pf. are mostly supplied from bio/w.- Exc. part. zw=ntos, Il.1.88, Hom. always uses the Ep. Ion. Lyr. pres. zw/w (also in Pi.O.2.25, Hdt.7.46, al., Diog.Apoll.4, Herod.2.29, IG12(8).600.9 (Thasos), and Trag. (in lyr.), S.El.157, OC1213, cf. BCH47.95 (Cavalla), Bull.Soc.Arch.Bulg.7.13 (Macedonia); subj. zw/h| IG12(8).262.12 (Thasos, v B.C.), cf. Schwyzer 339, al. (Delph.), contr. zw=| Berl.Sitzb.1927.161 (Cyrene); Cret. dw/w Leg.Gort.4.21, al.); inf. zwe/menai, -e/men, Od.7.140,24.436: impf. e)/zwon 22.245, Hes.Op.112, Hdt.4.112; Ion. zw/eskon Hes.Op.90, Bion 1.30: aor. 1 e)/zwsa （e)p-) Hdt.1.120; inf. zw=sai IG11(4).1299 (Delos): pf. part. e)zwko/ta BMus.Inscr.1009 (Cyzicus); inf. zo/ein Semon.1.17: impf. zo/en AP13.21 (Theodorid.). (Root
g[uglide]iē-, g[uglide]iō- also in bi/os and u(gih/s (q.v.).) prop. of animal life,
live, Hom. (v. infr.), etc.; also of plants, to\ zh=n koino\n ei)=nai fai/netai kai\ toi=s futoi=s Arist.EN1097b33; e)le/gxiste zwo/ntwn vilest
of living men, Od.10.72; zw/ein kai\ o(ra=n fa/os h)eli/oio Il. 24.558; zw=ntos kai\ e)pi\ xqoni\ derkome/noio 1.88, cf. Od.16.439; zw=n kai\ ble/pwn A.Ag.677; zw/ei te kai\ e)/stin Od.24.263; zw/ntwn kai\ o)/ntwn D. 18.72; tou= ei)=nai/ te kai\ zh=n e(/neka Pl.R.369d; zw=sa po/lis kai\ e)grhgorui=a Id.Lg.809d; zw=n kai\ e)/myuxos Id.Phdr.276a; r(ei=a zw/ontes
living at ease, of the gods, Il.6.138, al.; zw=n katakauqh=nai to be burnt
alive, Hdt.1.86: c. acc. temp., z. h)/mata pa/nta h.Ven.221, etc.; o)li/ga e)/tea Hdt.3.22: c. dat. modi, dmw=es . . a)/lla te polla\ oi(=si/n t' eu)= zw/ousi whereby men
live in comfort, Od.17.423, cf. D.60.5; kora/kwn ponhri/a| Ar.Th.868; e)pi\ toi=s ai)sxi/stois e)/rgois, e)pi\ toi=s parou=sin a)gaqoi=s, And.1.100, Isoc.10.18; also zh=n a)po/ tinos
to live on a thing, Thgn. 1156, Hdt.1.216, 2.36,4.22, Ar.Pax850, etc.; e)/k tinos Id.Ec.591, D. 57.36, 1 Ep.Cor.9.14: c. part., zh=n sukofantw=n And.1.99; e)rgazo/menoi Arist.Pol.1292b27: c. dat. commodi, zh=n e(autw=|
for oneself, dub. l. in E.Ion646, cf. Ar.Pl.470, Men.507; to\ zh=n,= zwh/, A.Pr.681, Pl. Phd.77d (without Art. ei)s e(/teron z. Id.Ax.365d); dia\ panto\s tou= zh=n Ep.Hebr.2.15; also,
a living, to\ z. ou)k e)/xomen OGI515.57 (Mylasa, iii A.D.); zh/tw o( basileu/s
long live the king, LXX 1 Ki.10.24; basileu=, ei)s to\n ai)w=na zh=qi ib.Da.3.9; asseverations, zw= e)gw/, kai\ zw=n to\ o)/noma/ mou, kai/ . . ib.Nu.14.21; zh=| ku/rios, ei) . . , o(/ti . . , ib.1 Ki.19.6, 29.6; zh=| h( yuxh/ sou, ei) oi)=da ib.17.55. = bio/w,
live, pass one's life, c. acc. cogn., zw/eis d' a)gaqo\n bi/on Od.15.491; z. bi/on moxqhro/n S.El.599, cf. E.Med.249, Ar.V.506, etc.; zo/hn th\n au)th/n Hdt.4.112, cf. Pl.R.344e; to\n bi/on a)sfalw=s Philem.213.5; h(/diston a)nqrw/pwn bi/on S.Fr.583.4; numfi/wn bi/on Ar.Av.161; also z. a)blabei= bi/w| S.El.650, cf.Tr.168; eu)= zh=n Id.Ph.505; kakw=s Id.OC799; z. dou=los Id.OT410; e)k tw=n a)/llwn w(=n e)/zhs from the other
acts of your life, D.21.134; poiei=sqai fqo/non e)c w(=n zh=|s ib.196. aor. 1 e)/zhsa, causal,
quicken, e)n th=| o(dw=| sou zh=so/n me LXXPs.118(119).37, al.
live in the fullest sense, di' w(=n zh=n e)pista/meqa X.Mem.3.3.11, etc.; biou\s me\n e)/th to/sa, zh/sas de\ e)/th e(pta/ D.C.69.19; in religious or mystical sense, Ep.Rom.7.9, al., cf. Ramsay
Cilies and Bishoprics 2p.565 (Phryg.); qeo\s zw=n LXXDe.5.26(23), etc.: freq. metaph. of things,
to be in full vigour, o)/lbos zw/ei ma/sswn Pi.I.3.5; a)/ths qu/ellai zw=si A.Ag.819; zw=nti xrw/menos podi/ S.Fr.790; [mantei=a] ai)ei\ zw=nta peripota=tai Id.OT482; a)ei\ zh=| tau=ta [no/mima] Id.Ant.457; ta\s cumfora\s tw=n bouleuma/twn zw/sas ma/lista
have most
living power, Id.OT45; lo/gia zw=nta Act.Ap.7.38; xro/nw| tw=| zw=nti kai\ paro/nti S.Tr.1169; zw=sa flo/c
living fire, E.Ba.8; u(/dwr zw=n
spring water, LXXNu.5.17 (and metaph., Ev.Jo.4.10); zw/shs fwnh=s Cic.Att.2.12.2.
zwagri/a, h(,= zwgrei=on, Ael.NA13.10.

zwa/gria, wn, ta/, (zwo/s, a)gre/w, orig.
ransom paid for a prisoner taken alive) reward for life saved, zwa/gri' o)fe/lleis Od.8.462; dw=ra la/myonta<*> zwa/gria *kroi/sou Hdt.3.36; *qe/ti . . zwa/gria ti/nein Il.18.407, cf. Call.Fr.162, AP6.220.15 (Diosc.); rare in Prose, Demetr.Lac. Herc.1014.49; also,
offerings to Aesculapius and other gods
for recovery from illness, IG14.967a5: c. gen., nou/swn ibid.; z. a)poqu/ein Ael.NA11.31: sg. in Orac. ap. Plu.Arat.53—a form zw/gria, ta/, Suid.—Adj. zwa/grios, on, z. moi xa/ritas o)flh/seis you will owe me thanks
for a life saved, Babr.50.15.

zwalkh/s, e/s,
life-preserving, xei/r, of *paia/n, IG14.1015.
zw|a/rion, to/, Dim. of zw=|on, Sammelb.5224.57, Sch.A.R.1.1265, 3.276.

zwa/rkeia, h(,
means of subsistence, Sch.E.Hec.362: zwarki/a, Anon. Prog.in Rh.1.599 W.: zwarke/w,
support life, Gramm. in Reitzenstein Ind.Lect.Rost.1892/3P.10.

zwarkh/s, e/s,
life-supporting, au)gh/ Milet.6.18 (ii A.D.), cf. Procl.H. 1.2, Nonn.D.25.178; xrei/a PLond.5.1729.17, al.(vi A.D.); ta\ z.
the necessaries of life, Phot.

zw/|arxos, on,
commander of one elephant, Ascl.Tact.9.1, Ael.Tact. 23.1.

zwga/nhs, o(,
slave-king at festival in Babylon, Beros.3.

zw/gh, a kind of
plant, Hsch.

zwglu/fos [u^],= zw|ogl-, MitteisChr.129.15 (ii B.C.); recommendcd by Philem.Lex. (cf. Philol.57.353 sqq.) in Reitzenstein
Gesch.d.Gr. Etym.p.394.

zwgone/w, = zwogone/w, of a
living tree, POxy.1188.4 (i A.D.):— Pass., S.E.M.1.264 (s. v.l.).
zwgori/ths: o( o)po\s tou= o)pobalsa/mou, Hsch.

zwgra^f-ei=on, to/,
painter's studio, Plu.2.471f.

zwgra^f-e/w,
paint from life, paint, tina Pl.R.598b, etc.:—Pass., Id.Cra.434b: metaph., h(donai\ . . e)zwgrafhme/nai Id.Phlb.40b; o)nei/rous z. Porph.Chr.23.
adorn with paint, ta\s lhku/qous Ar.Ec.996; ta\s o)fru=s a)sbo/lw| Alex. 98.16, cf. Nicostr. ap. Stob.4.23.62. generally,
adorn, kh=pon su\n toi=s futoi=s Arch.Pap.2.449.

zwgra^/f-hma, atos, to/,
a picture, Pl.Phlb. 39d, Cra.430b sq.

zwgra^f-hto/s, h/, o/n,
painted, parti-coloured, Hsch. s.v. poiki/lon.

zwgra^f-i/a, h(,
art of painting, Democr.28a, Pl.Phdr.275d, X.Mem.1.4.3: metaph., fusikh\ z. Secund.Sent.14.
painting, tw=n pareiw=n v.l. in Philostr.Ep.22 (cod. Barocc.50); tou= stu/lou IGRom.1.1272 (Egypt, ii A.D.). metaph., e)pi\ skia=| (sc. ou)si/a） zwgrafi/a kai\ to\ fai/nesqai Plot.6.3.8.

zwgra^f-i/des,
picturae, Gloss.

zwgra^f-iko/s, h/, o/n,
skilled in painting, Pl.Tht.145a, X.Smp.4.21: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh)
the art of painting, D.S.14.46;
connected with painting, used by painters, ge/nh BGU10.11 (ii A.D.); a)sbolh/ Dsc.5.162. Adv. -kw=s S.E.M.11.255.

zw/gra^f-os, o(, (zwo/s or zwh/, gra/fw)
one who paints from life or
from nature, Hdt.2.46, Pl.Grg.448c, 453c, Lg.656e, etc.: metaph., politeiw=n z. Id.R.501c: generally,
painter, Luc.Herod.4, Epigr.41. (zwgr- without iota, PSI4.346, 407 (iii B.C.), SIG682.3 (ii B.C.), Pap. in Abh.Berl.Akad.1904(2).6(ii B.C.), EM 412.53: so zwgrafi/a SIG960.13 (ii B.C.), Phld.Rh.2.166S.）
zwgr-ei/a, v. zwgri/a.
zwgr-eu/s, e/ws, o(, dub. l. (for zw=|on?) in Gal.4.497 (BpW36.799).
zwgr-eu/w,= zwgre/w, Polyaen.4.3.27 (Pass.).

zwgr-e/w, (zwo/s, a)gre/w)
take, save alive, take captive instead of killing, zw/grei, *)atre/os ui(e/, su\ d' a)/cia de/cai a)/poina Il.6.46, cf. 10.378, Hdt.1.86, etc.; ei(=le . . kai\ e)zw/grhse Id.3.52; tou\s me\n a)pe/kteinan, tina\s de\ kai\ e)zw/grhsan Th.2.92; plh\n o(/son e)k triw=n new=n ou(\s e)zw/grhsan Id.7.23; plh\n mhdamh=| mhdamw=s zwgrou=ntas provided that they do not
spare him
alive, Pl.Lg.868c; opp. diafqei/rein, a)poktei=nai, Plb.3.84.10, LXXNu.31.18: metaph., a)nqrw/pous e)/sh| zwgrw=n Ev.Luc. 5.10; of ships, a(\s e)zw/grhsen au)ta/ndrous Charito 7.6:—Pass., Hdt.1.66,5.77.
restore to life and strength, revive, peri\ de\ pnoih\ *bore/ao zw/grei e)pipnei/ousa Il.5.698 (quoted by Aret.CA2.3);
preserve alive, zw/grei, de/spot' a)/nac, to\n so\n naeth=ra Epigr.Gr.841.7 (Thrace, ii A.D.).

zwgr-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
taking alive, zwgri/h| labei=n or ai(re/ein,= zwgrei=n, Hdt.6.28,37; sullabei=n SIG700.30 (Macedonia, ii B.C.) zwgri/a e)gkrath\s or ku/rios gene/sqai tino\s, Plb.1.9.8, 1.79.4; zwgri/a a)na/gesqai or ei)sana/gesqai, Str.11.11.6, Plb.1.82.2; z. a)pobalei=n tina to lose him
by his being captured, ib.15.2, Str.8.4.2; z. a(lw=nai Plb.5.86.5.
zw/gr-ia, ta/, v. zwa/gria :
zw/gr-ion, to/, v. zwgrei=on.

zwgr-i/as, ou, o(,
one taken alive, zwgri/an sullamba/nein, e(lei=n tina, Ctes.Fr.29.3,9, Zos.1.51; ou) kateli/pomen zwgri/an LXXDe.2.34; zwgri/as e)lh/fqh D.S.25.10; zwgri/as e)/labe disxili/ous ibid.; zwgri/ai e(a/lwsan Memn.56.3.

zw=gros, o(, late form for zwgrei=on,
cage, Phlp.
in de An.106.12, Sch. Nic.Th.825. zw=gron: e)grh/goron, Hsch.
zwgu/s, v. zwtu/s.

zw|dari/dion, to/, Dim. of zw=|on,
tiny figure, HeroSpir.2.34 (P.312.10S.), Wiener Denkschr.47(4).59.

zw|da/rion, to/,= foreg., Dim. of zw=|on,
animalcule, as
a grub, Alex. 140, Arist.HA557b1, etc. = zw/|dion 1, IG22.1491.4, Inscr.Délos 298A31 (iii B.C.), SIG2588.31 (Delos, ii B.C.), Hero Spir.2.34,
PMag. Leid.V.10.1.

zw|di-a^ko/s, h/, o/n, (zw/|dion)
of or
for zw/|dia, zw|diako/s (with or without ku/klos), o(,
the Zodiac, Eudem. ap. Theo Sm.p.198H., Phld.Mus.p.100 K., Cleom.1.4, al., D.S.2.31, etc.; also h( zw|diakh/ (sc. o(do/s) Man.4.168. Adv. -kw=s Ptol.Tetr.198, Vett.Val.22.12, PMich.in Class.Phil. 22.13.
zw|di-a/rxhs, ou, o(,= zw|diokra/twr, Dam.Pr.132.
zw|dio-glu/fos [u^], on, （glu/fw）= zw|oglu/fos, Plu.2.712e.

zw|dio-kra/twr [a^], oros, o(,
divinity presiding over the zodiac, Dam.Pr.131,351.

zw/|di-on, to/, Dim. of zw=|on 11,
small figure, painted or
carved, Hdt. 1.70, IG12.374.288, 11(2).161 B74 (Delos, iii B.C.), Plu.2.673f;
statuette, OGI717.6 (Egypt, iii A.D.); of large figures, z. phxw=n e(kkai/deka D.S.1.47. Astron.,
sign of the Zodiac, dia\ me/swn tw=n z. Arist.Metaph.1073b20; o( ku/klos o( tw=n z. Id.Mete.343a24, cf. Plb.9.15.
7, Zeno Stoic.1.34, Hipparch.2.1.3, al., Gem.1.3, Autol.1.10, etc.:— also zwi+/dion, to/, Arat.544, Man.1.309, al.

zw|di-opoio/s,
signarius, Gloss.

zw|di-ofo/ros,
signifer, ib.
zw|di-wto/s, h/, o/n, （zw/|dion） = zw|wto/s, Poll.7.55, Hsch.
zw/zw, late spelling of sw/|zw, UPZ81ii19, Sammelb.1060, etc.

zw/|eios, a, on,
animal, opp. a)nqrw/peios, i(/ppeios, Dam.Pr.85.

zwh/ ( zwih/ (prob. an error) SIG577.34 (Milet., iii/ii B.C.)), Dor. zwa/: Ion. and poet. zo/h, Hdt.1.32, Herod.10.4, S.Fr.556, etc. (v. infr.), cf. IG9(1).86 (Hyampolis), Dor. zo/a: Aeol. zoi+/a Theoc. 29.5: h(:—
living, i.e. one's
substance, property, h)= ga/r oi( z. g' h)=n a)/spetos Od.14.96; toi\ de\ zwh\n e)da/santo ib.208; kata\ zwh\n fage/ein 16.429; th\n zo/hn poie/esqai or katasth/sasqai a)po\ or e)k . . to get one's
living by . . , Hdt.8.105, cf. 2.36, Arist.HA608b21; e)c a(lo/s Theoc.Beren. 2. after Hom.,
life, existence, opp. death, Tyrt.15.5, Pi.N.8.36, etc.; qana/tou pe/ri kai\ zwa=s ib.9.29; ou)de\n ga\r a)/lgos oi(=on h( pollh\ zo/h S.Fr.556; zo/as （zwa=s codd.) biota/ E.HF664 (lyr.); tou= bi/ou zwh/ Pl. Ti.44c; o( th=s z. xro/nos SIG1210 (Calymna), etc.: as a term of affection, zwh/
mylife! Juv.6.195: pl., zo/ai A.Fr.99.13; zwai/ LXXPs.62(63).3(4); meta\ th\n mi/an z. pollai\ z. Dam.Pr.100; ai( th=s yuxh=s z. kai\ duna/meis Iamb.Comm.Math.3.
way of life, zo/hn e)/zwon th\n au)th/n Hdt. 4.112, cf. 114. zwh/,= grau=s 11,
the scum on milk, Eust.906.52; zo/h: to\ e)pa/nw tou= me/litos, Hsch. [The form zo/h (paroxyt.) is required by the metre in trimeters in S.Fr.556, E.Hec.1108, and in lyrics S. Fr.592, E.Med.976, al., zwh/ never: zo/h in other Poets, Call.Fr.114, Theoc.Ep.18.9, Herod.10.4.] (For the root, cf. zw=: fancifully connected with ze/w and zhte/w, Dam.Pr.81: in signf. 11 zo/h prob. fr. ze/w.)

zw|hdo/n, Adv., (zw=|on)
in the manner of beasts, Plb.6.5.9.

zwhro/s, a/, o/n, (zwh/)
living and
giving life, Suid.

zwhto/s, h/, o/n,
capable of being vitalized, Dam.Pr.83 bis.

zwhfo/ros, on,
life-bringing, Them.Or.19.228d, Sch.Il.8.70; z. grammh\ [xeiro/s] line
of life, in palmistry, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.238.

zwqa/lmios, on, (zwh/, qa/llw)
giving the bloom and freshness of life, Pi.O.7.11.

zwqalph/s, e/s, (qa/lpw)
warming or
cheering life, Nonn.D.1.454:— fem. zw/qalpis, idos, ib.16.397 (v.l. -pe/es).

zwqh/kh, h(,
small room wherein to rest by day, opp.
dormitorium (the bedroom), Plin.Ep.2.17.21;
zothecula, ib.5.6.38.
niche in a wall, prob. in Apollod.Poliorc.145.1 (pl.); used as a
chapel, Supp.Epigr.2.849（Alexandria); Lat.
zotheca, Dessau ILS5449, al.
zwi+/dion, to/, v. zw/|dion ad fin.

zwi+ko/s, h/, o/n, (zw=|on)
of or
proper to animals, h( z. fu/sis Arist.PA 645a6, cf. 681b4; h( z. i(stori/a a history
of animals, ib.668b30: peri\ zwi+kw=n, title of lost work by Aristotle, Ath.7.328f.
animal, yuxh/, sw=ma, Porph.Gaur.1.2, 13.4; z. a)/nqrwpos Dam.Pr.200.
zw/i+on, to/, poet. for zw=|on, Semon.13.
zwi+to/s or zw|di-to/n, or zw|t-, dub. sens. in BCH8.307 (Delos, iv B.C.).
zwkth/r, h=ros, o(, dub. l. in PLond.2.236.8 (iii A.D., fort. zwsth/r).

zw=ma, atos, to/, (zw/nnumi)
loin-cloth, drawers, worn next the body in a boxing contest, z. de/ oi( prw=ton paraka/bbalen Il.23.683; in war, 4.216; e(po/mhn sa/kos oi)=on e)/xwn kai\ z. faeino/n Od.14.482; zw/mata kai\ kupa/ssides Alc.15.6. = e)/nduma, pezofo/rois z. A.Fr.246.
band used in surgery, Hp.Art.14. = zw/nh,
woman's girdle, e)/luse z. parqe/nw Alc.Supp.8.10, cf. S.El.452, IG22.1514.15, Ar.Fr. 320.7, Men.432, AP6.272 (Pers.).—A non-Att. form zw=sma (v. Thom.Mag.p.165 R.) in Str.7.2.3, Sor.Fasc.45, al., Ach.Tat.1.1, 3.21, Hld.3.1.
zwma/lmh: zwmo\s a(/lmhs *qasi/as, Sch.Suid. s.v. *qasi/an.
zwm-a/rion, to/, Dim. of zwmo/s, Damocr. ap. Gal.14.94.
zwm-a/rustron [a^], to/,= zwmh/rusis, Sch.Ar.Ach.244 (v.l. -os, h(); spelt zw/m-istron, POxy.1289.3 (v A.D.).

zw/m-euma, atos, to/,
soup, zwmeu/mata put by way of joke for u(pozw/mata new/s (v. u(po/zwma fin.), Ar.Eq.279.

zwm-eu/w, (zwmo/s)
boil into soup, krea/|dia e)zwmeume/na Id.Fr.591, cf. Phryn.PS p.68 B.:—Pass., Hp.Int.35, Dsc.Eup.2.122:
zwm-euto/s, h/, o/n, Orib.Fr. 119 (-istou/s in Paul.Aeg.5.13 codd.).

zwm-h/ru^sis, ews, h(, (a)ru/w A)
soup-ladle, Antiph.249, Philem.Jun.1.6, Anaxipp.6.1, IG22.1416 (iv B.C.), Ath.3.126d, AP6.101 (Phil.).
