zwm-i/dion, to/, Dim. of zwmo/s,
a little sauce, Ar.Nu.389.
zwmi/lh, h(,= a)/nhqon, Hsch., Phot.
zwm-i/on, to/, Dim. of zwmo/s, PTeb.112.75 (ii B.C.).
zwm-isto/s, v. zwmeuto/s.

zwmopoi-e/w,
make into soup or
sauce, Xenocr.54 (Pass.).

zwmopoi-o/s, o/n,
making sauce, Plu.2.218c.
serving to flavour soup, of mushrooms, Dsc.4.82.

zwmo/s, Dor. dwmo/s (q.v.), o(,
soup or
sauce to eat with meat, fish, etc., Ar.Eq.1174, Pax716, al.; oi( z. oi( tw=n pio/nwn
soups made from animals with soft fat (pimelh/), Arist.HA520a8, cf. PA651a29; z. me/las black
broth of the Spartans, Matro Conv.94, cf. Plu.Lyc.12: metaph.,
bloodshed, Thphr.Char.8.7. Com. name for
fat, greasy fellow, liparo\s peripatei= *dhmoklh=s, z. katwno/mastai Anaxandr.34.5, cf. Aristopho 4.3. in Alchemy,
wash, Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.48 B., Zos.Alch.p.169 B.

zwmota/ri_xos [a^], o(,
stewed salt-fish, as a nickname, Alex.42.
zwn-ai=oi, oi(, an order of divine beings (cf. zw/nh 1v), Dam.Pr.130; z. ko/smos the world over which they preside, ib.206. Adv. -ws ib. 131.
zwn-a/rion, to/, Dim. of sq., Anon.in Rh.114.19, Hdn.Epim. 41.

zw/n-h, h(, (zw/nnumi)
belt, girdle: prop.
the lower girdle worn by women just
above the hips, peri\ de\ zw/nhn ba/let' i)cui= Od.5.231, 10.544, cf. Il.14.181, Hdt.1.51, etc.—Phrases: lu=se de\ parqeni/hn z. unloosed her maiden
girdle, of the bridegroom, Od.11.245, cf. Lyr. Alex.Adesp.11.18, Plu.Lyc.15:—Med., of the bride, mou/nw| e(ni\ zw/nan a)ne/ri lusame/na AP7.324 (hence zw/nh, abs., of
marriage, E.IT204 (lyr.); of
sexual intercourse, Philostr.VA7.6): but also, z. lu=sai to loose
the girdle for childbirth, Hyp.Fr.67; later lu/sasqai or a)polu/sasqai, Call.Del.209, Opp.C.3.56; so zw/nan katati/qesqai Pi.O.6.39. of men on a march, z. lu/sasqai to slacken one's
belt, i.e. rest oneself, Hdt.8.120; z. a)nalu/esqai Call.Del.237. of pregnant women, te/knwn h)/negx' u(po\ zw/nhn ba/ros A.Ch.1000; pw=s ga/r s' e)/qreyen e)nto\s . . zw/nhs; Id.Eu.608; tou=ton . . e)/feron zw/nhs u(/po E.Hec. 762; also u(po\ zw/nh| qe/sqai to
conceive, h.Ven.255. prov., ei)s zw/nhn dedo/sqai to be given
for girdle-money (as we should say,
pinmoney), of Oriental queens who had cities given them for their small expenses, X.An.1.4.9; h(\n [xw/ran] kalei=n . . z. th=s basile/ws gunaiko/s Pl.Alc.1.123b. man's
belt (more freq. zwsth/r）, h( z. tou= *)wri/wnos the three stars that form the
belt of Orion. Arist.Mete. 343b24; the
belt of barbarians, in which they wore the dagger, X.An.1.6.10, 4.7.16, Theopomp.Hist.39a, Luc.Anach.33, Pl.Hp.Mi. 368c. belt used as a
purse, PRyl.127.32(i A.D.), Ev.Matt.10.9, Plu.2.665b; z. xrusi/on Luc.Fug.31.
part round which the girdle passed, waist, *)/arei+ zw/nhn i)/kelos Il.2.479 (misunderstood by Paus.9.17.3), cf. Il.11.234, Orph.Fr.168.28, Hp. ap. Erot. (also expld. as = o)sfu/s). = Lat.
cingulum, belt worn by Roman civil and military officers, [Demod.]5; = a)ci/wma, Suid.; oi( u(po\ zw/nhn
soldiers, Anon. ap. eund.s.v. au)qenth/santa, cf. Cod.Just.1.5.12.6, 11, Just.Edict. 13.26, PLond.5.1680.21 (vi A.D.).
anything that goes round like a belt, Plu.2.935a, Luc.Musc.Enc.3; of the
girdle of ocean, Porph. Chr.69.
one of the zones of the terrestrial sphere, Stoic.2.195, Posidon. ap. Str.2.2.2, Placit.2.12.1 (pl.), etc.; z. diakekaume/nh, eu)/kratos, Str.1.2.24, 1.4.6.
one of the planetary spheres, oi( me\n [tw=n planhtw=n] u(yhlh\n z. fe/rontai oi( de\ tapeinh/n Diog.Oen.8, cf. Vett.Val.26.18, Corp.Herm.1.25. Astrol.,= zw/|dion, Porph.in Ptol.186. in Archit.,= dia/zwma,
frieze, Paus.5.10.5. Lat.
zona, in Medic.,
shingles, Scrib.Larg.63, 247; cf. zwsth/r 111.3.
stripes on fish, Ael.NA3.28,al. pl., an order of divine beings presiding over, or
engirdled with cosmic
zones, opp. a)/zwnoi, Dam.Pr.96, Procl.in Prm.p.494S.

zwn-iai=os, a, on,
as thick as a girdle, pa/xos Ath.Mech.38.3.
zw/n-ion, to/, Dim. of zw/nh, Ar. Lys.72, Arist.Mir.832b23, AP5.157 (Asclep.), Plu.2.154b.

zwnioplo/kos, on,
plaiting or
embroidering girdles, Thom.Mag. p.168 R.

zwni=tis, idos, h(,
in belts or
seams, kadmei/a Dsc.5.74; cf. zw/nnumi 111.2.

zw/nnu_mi (u(po-zwnu/nai IG12.73.9), (para-) Pl.R.553c; zwnnu/w Hp. Mul.1.68: impf. e)zw/nnuon Ev.Jo.21.18: fut. zw/sw LXXEx.29.9, Ev.Jo. l.c.: aor. 1 e)/zwsa Od.18.76, Hp.Art.14: pf. e)/zwka Paus.8.40.2, (di-) D.H.2.5:—Med. (v. infr. 11):—Pass., aor. 1 e)zw/sqhn （di-) Thphr.Sign.22: pf. e)/zwmai （di-) Th.1.6 ap. Phot., Suid. s.v. se/swtai, 3sg. e)/zwtai （di-) IG22.1491.36, (u(p-) ib.1621.68, e)/zwstai Hp.Art.l.c.; also in med. sense (v. infr.): rare in Att., even in compds.:—
gird, esp.
gird round the loins for a pugilistic conflict (v. infr.), a)/gon zw/santes a)na/gkh| Od.18.76 (here only Act. in Hom.); zw=se/ [min] . . *)aqh/nh Hes.Op.72; z. tina/
hug him in wrestling, Paus.8.40.2; z. gai=an, of Ocean, AP9.778 (Phil.); z. nh=a o(/plw|,= u(pozw/nnumi 11, A.R.1.368: c. dupl. acc., z. tina\ zw/nhn LXX Le.8.7, cf. 1 Ki.17.39. Med., zw/nnu^mai,
gird oneself, esp. of athletes. gumno/s, zwnnume/nwn tw=n pri\n e)ni\ stadi/w| IG7.52.6 (Megara, iv B.C.); tw\ de\ zwsame/nw bh/thn e)s me/sson a)gw=na Il.23.685, cf. 710; zw/nnuntai/ te ne/oi kai\ e)pentu/nontai a)/eqla Od.24.89; *)odusseu\s zw/sato me\n r(a/kesin peri\ mh/dea 18.67, cf. Parth. 10.2. generally,
gird up one's loins for battle, zw/nnusqai a)/nwgen *)argei/ous Il.11.15; zw/nnusqai [zwsth=ri] 10.78: c. acc., o(/qi zwnnu/sketo mi/trhn 5.857 (vulg.); zw/sato de\ zw/nhn 14.181 (vulg.); xalko\n zw/nnusqai 23.130; e)s go/nu me/xri xitw=na zw/nnusqai Call.Dian.12; xitw=na ei)s mhro\n e)/zwsto Plu.Ant.4; for labour, Hes.Op.345; e)pi\ bousi/n A.R.1.426, etc.; zw/nnusqai ta\s koili/as zw/nais Theopomp.Hist. 39a. Pass.,
to be fixed by means of girths, LXX 1 Ma.6.37.
to be formed in belts or
seams, kadmei/a e)zwsme/nh （e)cwsm- codd.) prob. in Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.45B. (cf. zwni=tis). (zw（s)- from I.-E.
yōs-, cf. Lith.
júosti 'to gird',
júostas, Avest.
yāsta-,= zwsto/s 'girt'.)

zwno-ga/stores (-ga/striai cod.): oi( ta\s gaste/ras zwnnu/menoi, Hsch.: zwnoga/stwr: o( th\n gaste/ra zwnnu/menos, Gramm. in Reitzenstein
Ind. Lect.Rost.1892/3p.11, cf. Hsch. s.v. mesoga/stora.

zwno-dra/kontis [a^],
girdled with snakes, epith. of the moon, PMag.Par.1.2864.

zwno-eidh/s, e/s,
like a belt or
girdle, Apollon.Lex. s.v. i)/ressin e)oiko/tes, Eust. 1068.24. Adv. -dw=s
in belts, Olymp.in Mete.191.21.
zwno/s, f.l. for eu)/zwnos, Arist.Phgn.810b4.

zwnofo/ros, on,
wearing a belt, PRain.in Wiener Denkschr.42(2).4.
zw/nteion or zwntei=on, v. zhtrei=on.

zw/ntws,
vivide, Gloss.

zw|o-genh/s, e/s,
of animate kind, mortal, opp. a)eigenh/s, Pl.Plt.309c.

zw|o-glu/fos [u^], o(,
sculptor, AP12.56 (Mel.), 57 (Id.); cf. zwglu/fos.

zwogon-e/w,
propagate or
engender living creatures, of inanimate substances, h( fu/sis z. Thphr.CP3.22.3, cf. HP8.11.2 (so in Med., Id.CP3.24.3), Arist.Mir.835b26; of animals,
breed, like zwotoke/w, D.S.1.88, Plu.2.494c:—Pass., Arist.Mir.832a14: generally,
engender [stoixei=on] e(/kaston a)po\ e(te/rou -ei=tai Vett.Val.162.17.
to be viviparous, Thphr.HP7.14.3;
produce alive, Luc.Am.19; z. parqe/non, of Zeus,
producing Pallas
alive from his head, Id.DDeor.8, cf. D.S.1.23.
make alive, quicken, ti Thphr.CP4.15.2:—Pass., Arist.Fr.311, Isid. ap. Ath.2.93f: metaph., swfrosu/nh z. to\ fronou=n Ph.2.378, cf. 435. = zwgre/w,
preserve alive, LXX Ex.1.17, 1 Ki.
27.9; ku/rios qanatoi= kai\ z. ib.2.6, cf. Ev.Luc.17.33:—Pass., Act.Ap. 7.19.

zwogo/n-hsis, ews, h(,
creation of life, Theol.Ar.46.

zwogon-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
capable of generation, ib.49; su/llhyis Aët.1.142.
zwogon-iko/s, h/, o/n,= zwogonhtiko/s, Ph.2.148, Procl.Inst.155; nou=s Dam.Pr.272. Adv. -kw=s Procl.in Alc.p.52C.
zwo-gra/fos [a^], on, poet. for zwgr-, Theoc.15.81 (v.l. zw|o-).

zwo-doth/r, h=ros, o(,
giver of life, Orph.Fr.65:—fem. zwo-do/teira, Hsch.
zwo-do/ths, ou, o(,= foreg., Vett.Val.124.31, Them.Or.15.198b.
zwo-do/tion, to/,= meli/lwton, Ps.-Dsc.3.40.

zwo-eidh/s, e/s, (zw|o-)
like an animal, Gp.10.9.4.

zwo-qete/w, (ti/qhmi)
make alive, -ou=sa fu/sis Archel. ap. Antig.Mir.19.

zwo-qhri/a, h(, (zw|o-）
chasing living creatures, Pl.Sph.223b.

zwo-qhriko/s, h/, o/n, (zw|o-)
of or
for zw|oqhri/a, ib.221b: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh）= zw|oqhri/a, ib.220a, 222a.

zwo-qu^te/w,
sacrifice live victims, Thphr.(?) ap.Porph.Abst.2.26.

zwo-ke/fa^los, on, (zw|o-)
animal-headed, Anon.post Max.p.111L.

zwo/-morfos, on, (zw|o-)
in the shape of an animal, Plu.Num.8.

zw=|on, to/,
living being, animal, Hdt.5.10 (of bees), Ar.V.551, Pl. 443, etc.; pa=n o(/ ti per a)\n meta/sxh| tou= zh=n zw=|on a)\n le/goito Pl.Ti.77b; zw=|a, opp. futa/, Id.Phd.70d, 110e, etc.; z. qala/ttion, xersai=on, Phld. Rh.1.98S.; contemptuously, o(/pws h( xw/ra tou= toiou/tou zw/|ou kaqara\ gi/gnhtai may be free from this kind of
animal (i.e. beggars), Pl.Lg. 936c; z. ponhro/n, of women, Secund.Sent.8. in art,
figure, image, not necessarily of animals (cf. zw/|dion）, zw=|on de/ oi( e)nh=n, a)nh\r i(ppeu/s Hdt.3.88: mostly in pl., zw=|a e)s th\n e)sqh=ta e)ggra/fein Id.1.203, cf. 2.4,124,148, Pl.R.515a, etc.; zw=|a gra/yasqai th\n zeu=cin tou= *bospo/rou to have
pictures of the bridging of the Bosporus painted, Hdt.4.88; cf. zwgrafe/w: zw=|a poiei=n Plu.Per.13.
sign of the Zodiac, Man.2.166.—The word is post-Hom., no generic word used for
animal being found till after the middle of the fifth cent. B.C. (zw/i+on Semon.13, whence Att. zw=|on by contraction: i is found in IG12.372.42, al.,11(2).161B76 (Delos, iii B.C.), Phld.Rh.2.166S., and in codd. opt. in the Noun; the Adj. zwo/s (q.v.) had no i: for the compds. (exc. zwglu/fos, zwgra/fos) decisive evidence is lacking: zw|a/gria with i was read by Aristarch. in Il.18.407.)
zwo/nu^xon, to/, a name of the plant leontopo/dion, Ps.-Dsc.4.133.

zw|oplast-e/w,
mould to the life, make into statues, analogous to zwgrafe/w, Lyc.844 (zwo- codd.).
work into life-shape, z. qnhta\ ge/nh Ph.1.13.

zw|opla/st-hs, ou, o(,
the Creator, ib.184.
a moulder of creatures, sculptor, etc., Id.2.211.

zw|oplast-i/a, h(,
artistic representation, Eust.1157.25.

zwopoi/-hsis, ews, h(,
making alive, ib.2 Es.9.8.
zwopoi-i/a, h(,= zwogo/nhsis, Thphr.CP5.18.2, Dam. Pr.100.

zwopoi-o/s, o/n,
creative of life, Thphr.CP2.9.6, Procl.Inst.145, Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.11, Dam.Pr.80, al.: c. gen., z. th=s o(/lhs gene/sews ib.283; z. to\ u(/dwr kai\ go/nimon Sch.E.Ph.347.

zw|o-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
selling animals, esp. for sacrifice, Hsch.

zw|o/-pwlis (sc. a)gora/), h(,
beast-market, Id. (nisi leg. -pw/lion).

zwo/s (without i, cf. Schwyzer 436.2 (Crimisa, v/iv B.C.), Cret. dwo/s Leg.Gort.3.41, Cypr. pr. n. *zwvo/qemis Schwyzer684 (v B.C.)), h/, o/n, (zw=)
alive, living, Pi.P.4.209, Hdt.2.70, etc.; ou) . . zwou= ou)de\ qano/ntos Od.17.115; zwo
 e(lei=n tina to take prisoner, Il.6.38; zwo
 labei=n X. HG1.2.5; cf. zwgre/w: metaph., zwo
 de\ fqime/nwn . . kle/os A.Eleg.3. —Also zw/s Il.5.887, 16.445, Hdt.1.194, JRS15.145,148 (Cotiaeum) (zw=s Ptol.Ascal., zw/s Hdn.Gr.2.53; on the other cases, ib.712); zoo/s Archil.63, Epich.189, Berl.Sitzb.1927.161 (Cyrene), Theoc.2.5 (zo/os in Epich. l.c., Hdn.Gr.2.947).

zw|osta/sion [a^], to/, （i(/sthmi)
stall or
stable, Eust.531.17 (pl.).
zwota/mon, f.l. in Orph.A.315 codd. (zwa\ tamw/n Lobeck).

zwotok-e/w,
to be viviparous, opp. w)|otoke/w, Arist.Pol.1256b13; ta\ -ou=nta
viviparous animals, Id.GA732b8: generally zwotokei= a)h/r Ph. 1.263:—Pass.,
to be born alive, Arist.PA693b23.
zwotok-i/a, h(, Id.GA 754b29.

zwo/tok-os, on, opp. w)|oto/kos, Id.HA489a34, al., Ph.1.502; [bo/es]
bringing forth live calves, Theoc.25.125.
life-giving, Nonn.D. 26.191, al.

zw|otrof-ei=on, to/,
place for keeping animals, Gloss.

zw|otrof-e/w,
breed or
have parasitic animals, Thphr.CP2.17.8: generally a)h\r z. ma=llon gh=s Ph.1.641.
keep animals, Id.2.233.

zw|otrof-i/a, h(,
feeding of animals, Pl.Plt.261e.

zw|otrof-iko/s, h/, o/n,
connected with the feeding of animals, ib.263e: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),= zw|otrofi/a, ib.267b.

zw|o/trof-os, on,
nourishing animals. Max.Tyr.39.4, 41.5.

zw|otu/pos [u^], on,
modelling animals from life, Nonn.D.5.527, Man. 4.343: generally,
modelling to the life, of a sculptor, AP15.1.

zw|ofa^g-e/w,
live on animal food, Arist.HA590b1.

zw|ofa^g-i/a, h(,
a living on animal food, ib.628b13, Porph.Abst.2.27, 4.21.

zw|o/fa^g-os, on,
carriivorous, opp. karpofa/gos, Arist.Pol.1256a25, cf. PA696b29.

zwo/fqalmon, to/,= a)ei/zwon to\ me/ga, Dsc.4.88. =
leaf-rosette, Plin.HN25.160.

zwofor-e/w, of animals,
bring forth alive, Arist.HA638a31; of plants,
bear fruit, Gp.5.13.1.

zwo/for-os, on,
life-giving, IG3.171; a)/nemoi AP9.765 (Paul. Sil.). zw|ofo/ros, on,
bearing animals: and so,
bearing the figures of animals, sculptured, pi/nakes D.S.18.26; Lat.
zophorus, as Subst.,
frieze, Vitr.3.5.10. o( z. ku/klos,= o( zw|diako/s, Arist.Mu.392a11, Corp.Herm.13.12, etc.; without ku/klos, Ph.2.153, AP14.124; sfai=ra h( z. （zwhf- cod.) Ph.2.294.

zwofu^t-e/w,
put forth live shoots, flourish, PCair.Zen.72.4 (iii B.C.), Apollod.Hist. ap. Ath.15.682d, PMasp.104.6 (vi A.D.).
produce alive or
endow with life, Ph.2.372: with v. l. zwofuei=n, ib.294.

zwo/fu^t-os, on,= zw/futos 11, me/rh Plu.2.701c. zwo/fu^ton, to/,
zoöphyte, S.E.P.1.41 codd. = a)ei/zwon to\ me/ga Ps.-Dsc.4.88.

zw|o/w,
fashion into an animal, pf. inf. Pass. e)zw|w=sqai Alex.Aphr. in Top.137.26.

zwo/w,
impregnate, zwou=sa qorh/ Aret.SD2.5:—Pass., Porph.Gaur. 1.1, 3.1.
quicken, make alive, LXXPs.79(80).18;
endow with life, e(auto\ ou)sioi= kai\ zwoi= Dam.Pr.80, Phlp.in GC200.6:—Pass., Hp. Alim.38, Gal.19.174,180, Phlp.in GC151.5, Id.
in de An.64.7, al.; qhri/on zwwqe\n to\ sw=ma Plot.1.1.10, cf. 4.4.28; [gh=] e)zwwme/nh Id.6.7.12. Pass., of putrescent plants,
breed worms, Thphr.CP5.18.2 (nisi leg. zw|o-).

zw/pissa, h(,
pitch and wax from old ships, or
pine-resin, Dsc.1.72.

zwpone/w,
represent alive, AP9.742 (Phil.).

zwpu/ra, h(, a plant,= klinopo/dion, Hsch.;
zopyrontion, Plin.HN 24.137.
zwpu/reios, h(, medicine named after the physician Zopyrus, Orib. Fr.125, cf. Gal.14.205, Paul.Aeg.7.11.

zwpu^r-e/w, (zw/puron)
kindle into flame, cause to blaze up, z. tou\s a)/nqrakas Men.71; to\ pneu=ma z. Thphr.Ign.27:—in Pass.,
to be quickened by fire, of the foetus, Hp.Vict.1.9. metaph., me/rimnai zwpurou=si ta/rbos A.Th.290 (lyr.); zwpuroume/nas freno/s Id.Ag.1034 (lyr.); th=s fu/sews to\ zwpurou=n Arist.PA670a25, cf. Plu.2.940c; z. tina/
to provoke him, Ar.Lys.682 (lyr.); z. trufh/n
increase it, Plu.Lyc.9; in Magic,
quicken, fill with power, PMag.Leid.V.10.7 (Pass.). intr.,
burst into flame, h)\n h( qe/rmh zwpurh=| Aret.SD1.8.
zwpu^/r-hma, atos, to/,= zw/puron 1, gloss on feya/luc, Sch.Ar.Lys.107.

zwpu^r-hte/on,
one must kindle, Ph.1.187.

zwpu^/r-ion, to/,= klinopo/dion, prob. in Dsc.3.95 (from the name of the physician Zopyrus). zwpu/ria, ta/,
bellows, Phot., Suid. (nisi leg. zwpurei=a).

zwpu^r-i/s, i/dos, h(,
kindling up, reviving, Jul. Or.5.172b.

zw/pu^r-on, to/,
spark or
hot coal, used to kindle
a fire: hence metaph., smikra\ z. tou= tw=n a)nqrw/pwn diasesws me/na ge/nous (of the survivors of the flood), Pl.Lg.677b, cf. Luc.Tim.3; so [to\ baru\ kai\ kou=fon] oi(=on z. a)/tta kinh/sews Arist.Cael.308a2; braxe/a tina\ z. th=s *aukou/rgou nomoqesi/as Plu.2.240a; z. ti pro\s swthri/an bi/ou Max.Tyr. 2.4; zw/pura th=s i)di/as swthri/as Ph.2.519; z. filanqrwpi/as
flashes of humanity, Nic.Dam.Fr.127J. Act.,
pair of bellows, Ephor. 42J.

zw/pu^r-os, on,
glowing, of desire, qermo\n kai\ z. Philostr.VA1.34.
restorative, e)/xei ti z. o( tou= prosw/pou perispoggismo/s Sor. 2.28.

zwpu^/r-wsis, ews, h(,
kindling, Max. Tyr.9.7.

zwropot-e/w,
drink neat wine, Call.Fr.109, AP11.25 (Apollonid.).

zwropo/t-hs, ou, o(,
drinking neat wine, Hedyl. ap. Ath.11.497d; oi)/nou Man.4.300; o)fqalmoi\ . . ka/lleos a)krh/tou zwropo/tai AP5.225 (Paul. Sil.).

zwro/s, o/n,
pure, sheer, prop. of wine without water, like a)/kra_tos, z. me/qu A.R.1.477; po/ma AP12.50 (Asclep.); po/tos Hippoloch. ap. Ath.4.129d: abs., zwro/s (sc. oi)=nos) AP6.105 (Apollonid.), etc.: Comp., zwro/teron de\ ke/raie mix the wine
more pure, i.e. add less water, Il.9.203, cf. Arist.Po.1461a14; kera/sas zwro/teron '*omhrikw=s Ephipp.10; so later -o/teron pi/nein Hdt.6.84; and in the sense drink
hard, z. piei=n Thphr.Char.4.6, cf. Ael.VH13.4, Luc.Tim.54, etc.; pi/nein-ote/rw| xrw/menon oi)noxo/w| Antiph.149; zwro\n de/pas a cup
of sheer wine, AP11.28 (Marc. Arg.); zwro\n pe/lagos a sea
of wine, ib.7.457.6 (Aristo); zwro/teron kissu/bion ib.5.288.4 (Agath.); of drugs, Luc. DMort.7.1, Nav.45; dido/nai ti zwro/teron e)sqi/ein Hp.Nat.Mul.69; -o/teron ga/la Ruf.Fr.118: metaph., zwrota/th mani/h AP7.30 (Antip. Sid.). (In Philum.Ven.2.3, 4.2 zwro/s is opp. a)/kratos, and so perh. in Emp.35.15, but the reading is doubtful.)

zwru/a, h(, perh.=
pipe for running water, (zwo/s, r(e/w) IG4.823.46 (Troezen); cf. u(droru/a.
zw=ruc,= diw=ruc, PMeyer20.18 (iii A.D.), Stud.Pal.20.70.25 (iii A.D.).
zw/s, rarer form for zwo/s (q.v.).

zw/simos, on, (zw=)
viable, Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.47;
likely to survive, Aët. 13.22, Horap.1.38.
pertaining to this life, ta\ z. prob. in Phld. Herc.1251.9.

zw=sis, ews, h(, (zw/nnumi)
girding on, cincture, sa/kkwn LXXIs.22.12.
zw=sma, v. zw=ma. zw/steion, v. zh/treion.

zwsth/r, h=ros, o(, (zw/nnumi) in Il. always
a warrior's belt, prob. of leather covered with metal plates, o(/qi zwsth=ros o)xh=es xru/seioi su/nexon 4.132; daida/leos, panai/olos, ib.135,186; foi/niki faeino/s 7.305, cf. Hdt.9.74, S.Aj.1030; of an Amazon, Pi.Fr.172: in Od., a swineherd's
belt, 14.72, cf. Theoc.7.18,26.17. later,= zw/nh,
a woman's girdle, Paus.1.31.1: metaph., of the encircling sea, nh=soi . . , a(\s . . z. *ai)gai/ou ku/matos e)nto\s e)/xei AP9.421 (Antip. Thess.); w)keano\s a)tlantiko\s z. Secund.Sent.2.
anything that goes round like a girdle:
stripe marking certain height in the ship, Hld.1.1.
grass-wrack, Posidonia oceanica, Thphr.HP4.6.2, Plin.HN13.135. = zw/nh 111.4, ib.26.121. name of a
cape on the west coast of Attica, Hdt.8.107, Hyp.Fr.67, etc. epith. of Apollo at Zoster, AB261(sed leg. *zwsth/rios). zwsth=res *)enuou=s, of warriors, Call.Ap.85. name of a phgh/ in the Chaldaean system, Dam.Pr.96.

*zwsth/rios, a, on,
of *zwsth/r (a place on the west coast of Attica), *zwsth/rios *)apo/llwn IG12.324.70, Euph.95b, Paus.1.31.1, cf.foreg.IV. 2; *zwsthri/a, epith. of Athena, Schwyzer319(Delph., vi/v B.C.), IG 12.324.97(v B.C.), Paus.9.17.2, St.Byz. s.v. *zwsth/r, Hsch. (-steira cod.); *)aqhna= zwsth=ra (sic) AB261. zwsth/rion, to/,= zwsth/r, dub. in PLond.2.402.8(ii B.C.), cf.Gloss.

zwsthrokle/pths, ou, o(,
one who steals belts, Lyc.1329.

zw/st-hs, ou, o(,
one who girds, Gloss.

zwst-o/s, h/, o/n,
girded, u(pe/nduma Plu.Alex.32, cf.X.Eph.1.2, Hsch.s.v. zw=stra.

zw=st-ma, h(,
head-band, fillet, Theoc.2.122(pl.).

zwst-ri/s,
cingulum, Gloss.

zw=st-ron, to/,
belt, girdle, Od.6.38(pl.).
*zwtea/tas, epith. of Apollo at Argos, Hsch.: *zwtelisth/s, epith. of Apollo at Corinth, Id.
zw/teion, to/, v. zh/treion.

zwtiko/s, h/, o/n, (zw=)
fit for giving or
maintaining life, e)piqumi/a Pl. Ti.91b; duna/mies Ti.Locr.100d, cf. D.S.2.51（Sup.), Gal.15.506; pneu=ma LXXWi.15.11; i)kma/s Corn.ND2; fw=s Porph.Marc.13; to\ u(gro\n -w/teron tou= chrou= Arist.GA761a27, cf. 733a11; [e)/ar] -wta/th w(/ra Thphr.CP1.13.4.
full of life, alive, Pl.R.610e, Thphr. HP1.14.2, Porph.Gaur.16.3,5; ta\ th/qua zwtikw/tera tw=n spo/ggwn
more like animals, Arist.PA681a10; ta\ -w/tata me/rh (of the body) Plu.2.130b. Adv. -kw=s, e)/xein to be
fond of life, Id.Cat.Mi.70.
characteristic of life, vital, to\ au)ta\ u(f' au(tw=n kinei=sqai zwtiko/n Arist. Ph.255a6; to/nos, pneu=ma, fu/sis, Stoic.2.235, 241,272; ki/nhsis Herm. ap.Stob.1.41.7, cf. Plot.6.7.5（Comp.), Porph.Sent.37; kata\ to\ z. Procl.Inst.189. Adv. -kw=s ib.39, Dam.Pr.79, Herm. ap. Stob.l.c. z. xro/nos duration
of life, Vett.Val.132.4; of works of Art,
true to life, to\ z. fai/nesqai pw=s e)nerga/zh| toi=s a)ndria=sin; X.Mem.3.10.6; -w/tata e)cerga/sasqai Plu.2.668d.
zwtu/s (or zwgu/s): qw/rac, Hsch.
zw|u/llion, to/,= sq., Tz.H.9.957.
zw|u/fion [u^], to/, Dim. of zw=|on, zw/|dion, Ath.5.210c, Gal.6.666, Hsch., cj. for zwo/futa in S.E.P.1.41.

zwfor-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
the sun's progress through the zodiac, Man. 4.510.
zw/for-os, on, （fe/rw） = zwofo/ros (q.v.).

zwfu^t-e/w,
thrive, flourish, of trees or plants, POxy.1188.3(i A.D.), cf. PLond.2.214(iii A.D.); zwfutou=n a)/lsos BCH44.79（Lagina).

zw/fu^t-os, on, (fu/w)
giving life to plants, fertilizing, ai(=ma A.Supp.857; gh= Plu. Rom.20. Pass.,
spring from the earth, ta\ z.
plants, Diusap. Stob.4.21.16.
zw/w, Ep. and Ion. for zw=.

zw|-w/dhs, es,
like an animal, animal, ka/llos Democr.105; dai/mwn Posidon. ap. Gal.5.469; bi/os Plu.2.8a, Aret.SD1.5; ai)sqh/seis Ph.2.22（Sup.), cf.M.Ant.7.55; e)ne/rgeiai Dam.Pr.102; h(donh/ Marin.Procl. 4; of persons,
brutish, Aret.SD1.7; but e)s xroih\n z.
like a living person (of one dead), Id.SA2.11.

zw|-wdi/a, h(,
animal nature, Iamb. Protr.21.is/. <

zw/wsis, ews, h(, (zwo/w)
making alive, [Gal.]19.174.

zw|wto/s (with i, Inscrr., v. infr.), h/, o/n, also o/s, o/n Charesap.Ath. 12.538d: (zw=|on):—
adorned with figures, fare/tra IG11(2).161 B100 (Delos, iii B.C.); xitw/n Callix.2; e)fapti/s Plb.30.25.10; sku/fos OGI 214.54(iii B.C.); au)lai=ai Chares l.c.
